reviews.text: I do not reccomend this Cheesecake Factory I felt like I was eating in a crowded cafeteria <br>Especially during this time of proper sanitation and social distancing.<br>We waited 30 minutes to be seated<br>Once seated we waited 15 minutes to get water we were just about to leave and then bread comes... still no water? <br><br>Our table was extremely close to other tables, we did not feel as if they are even using the 6 feet rule for any of the tables here. <br>Staff was rude and short and hard to reach when you needed something. Never got butter for toast or ketchup for eggs. We asked and by the time the waitress came back we were basically done with the food<br>Took forever to get the check. I wanted to leave the entire time <br>I will not be coming back here

Easy 5 stars!<br>Everything is yummy. Food arrives rather quick, and you get bread while you wait.<br>My favorites are the California Guacamole salad, and the combination dish of Salmon and Steak Diane.

Not my first time here but everytime I go I always order a steak...Havent had a bad experience yet.<br>Everything that I&#39;ve ordered today was on point...Good and full I&#39;m ready for my next stop...

I want to buy some bread tonight, but the woman at the cake shop is really not nice, she was so rude to talk to me, even ignore me. So bad services. But the food is good, I&#39;ll come back for the food

Food bad service slow are you just sit there with no one to take your order then when you do they come back an say oh that&#39;s not on menu are we stop serving that earlier you knew before you took order just keep it moving

Not as good as other cheese cake factories that I have dined at.<br><br>The food quality was not as pleasantly presented, pretty hit n miss on the plate.<br><br>My husband ordered the fish n chips, which were lack lustre with the flavour.  I ordered the speciality split plate of steak Diane and Madeira chicken...the meat quality was not as good as other establishments..also the sauce for both was the same? <br><br>We sat outside om their patio area, which was v loud. Also the chairs are too low in height for the tables, so made for awkward eating.

Came to this location and the bar server Lucy was very very rude for no reason!! She slammed a drink on our table and was supposedly upset because the server told us we can sit in a certain bar area... due to her service I will never come to this location again ever

The location of this restaurant is really great! The mall provides a good and convenient alternate entrance/exit. There are many food options that are good and the cheesecake for dessert is always good!. Indoor and outdoor seating available! <br>*accessible*

Have always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory until this evening. First off there is some sort of a plumbing issue because the outside patio and the entire entrance of the restaurant smells like a sewer and I cant comprehend how people casually eat outside. Next, had to ask for bread probably 3 times. We ordered grilled salmon and chicken parm. The potatoes with the salmon were ice cold and rock solid. The salmon came out first because the chicken parm, the kitchen messed up on. Then once we were done with the salmon, the chicken parm came out wrong once again. Server was not helpful whatsoever. Tonight was a huge let down and the food as well as service get a 0/10.

I know we are going through a crisis but I expect more for a $50+ take-out meal.    The ordering interface online is excellent and allows you to customize your order however you like. Too bad they don&#39;t pay attention to it.   We ordered two dinner salads both with dressing already mixed in Plus extra dressing on the side.  Two kids meals mini burgers with fries and lemonade.  <br><br>One salad came with no dressing mixed in it and half a container on the side so my dinner was ruined. Dry Asian salad.  The other salad a chopped salad looked OK but the chicken was not chopped up and it seemed lunch size not dinner sized.  We got two slices of brown bread and two slices of sourdough bread although we ordered four meals which was very skimpy. Finally the fries were ice cold and soggy. I live less than 1 mile from the restaurant so it&#39;s not like I had a long ride and I picked it up just as they were putting it on the counter.  <br><br>So, thank you for staying open in this crisis but please get on top of your game again cheesecake.  I can&#39;t imagine spending this kind of money on food and it being ill prepared.  I might as well have thrown away $50.

We&#39;ve eaten at other locations and it has been pretty good. First, the outside eating Area smells like old rugs or a used mop. Something that hasn&#39;t been properly washed in a while. I don&#39;t even understand how it&#39;s possible. Wash your mop???? Also this place needs a new chef. Everything we had was either over fried (cauliflower ) or too sweet, swimming in fat (Brussel sprouts and wontons)  the salads were ok but they also tasted oily and overly done somehow. Not going back, disappointed.

This outpost of upscale chain Cheesecake Factory is located inside Aventura Mall and is really about average for the chain.   To be totally blunt, nothing stands out as memorable.<br><br>The very close spacing of the tables for this location versus others I have visited was both a blessing and a curse.  We had no choice but to make friends with the Argentinian family sitting next to us, as we were bumping elbows anyway.  The no-choice-but-to-hear-the-conversation part was a drag, but the wife of the couple turned out to be a cosmetic dentist, and I just made an appointment with her to indulge my vanity.  I understand the need to cover a likely expensive rent inside Aventura Mall, but this was extreme on the tight spacing.<br><br>Parking at Aventura Mall is abundant.  The big drawback is GETTING to the parking through the gridlock all the way from I-95 and up and down Biscayne Blvd.<br><br>Food and service here are just what you would expect.  Cheesecake Factory is as predictable as McDonald&#39;s, just a good bit classier.<br><br>One unexpected advantage is the close proximity to one of the coolest Apple Stores in America.  It&#39;s also right around the corner from Zara men&#39;s store.  Yep, gimme some slightly overpriced food, some heavily overpriced technology and some cheap chic knock-off clothing, and I&#39;m happy for the afternoon!

Undoubtedly, this franchise has a following but every time I go (seldom), I leave not getting the hype. The wait is so long that you may turn birthdays before getting seated. This hostess greeted us with a &#34;how many..?&#34; - Well, hello there to ya too..! Once my table&#39;s ready, 9 out of 10 times, it needs cleaning or floor needs sweeping..why is this the norm &amp; not the exception..? They&#39;re so eager to turn tables that they miss the mark about guests expecting a good &amp; clean dining experience. <br><br>Server - Jason was barely animated to greet us &amp; only got a smirk from him when he delivered the check to us. He took about 10mins. to show up to our table &amp; when we all ordered water, he seemed to have lost more of an interest since he knew the bill wasn&#39;t going to be as high as he may have expected; and to flag him down to get more water felt like a remote village had a better chance of getting some. Add more gripe, a client next to us told him that there was a &#34;bug&#34; in her broccoli.  He picked up the dish &amp; told her that what she saw was part of the veggie &amp; unapologetically, placed it back down &amp; walked away...yup...can&#39;t make this stuff up..! <br><br>Ordered: <br>*Skinnylicious Chicken Salad Sandwich ($12.50) - Greens w: vinaigrette was flavorful but this salad usually comes w: tomatoes but guess not today...! Chicken salad - savory but very little served. Know it&#39;s Skinnylicious but that&#39;s because of lighter ingredients not portion skimming. If so, reduce price. <br>*Turkey Club w: fries - lacked the main essentials which are turkey &amp; bacon but there was plenty of lettuce. Maybe they kitchen confused it with a BLT.... <br>*Crusted Chicken w: pasta ($13.50) - good portion. Chicken was lightly breaded &amp; pasta lightly buttered - worth ordering. <br>*Celebration Cheesecake - deliciously creamy...if they don&#39;t have great cheesecakes, don&#39;t know who will..! <br><br>I get it..! The place is popular with the masses but service, &amp; this time food too, has never met my expectations which for the $$$, it should all be equally impressive...Better Bon Appétit to you...!

I need to preface this by saying I went late, about 30-45 minutes before closing. Service was good, the host initially couldn&#39;t find us a table, and I think she asked one of the servers to service an extra table for us which was very nice, Michael the waiter was also attentive and got the food out fast. <br><br>Food was the major issue, it looked good until you started eating it. The pasta in the Chicken Bellagio tasted old and the rice in the Carne Asada was more a paste than rice (though the steak itself was good).<br><br>Again it was late, so this may not reflect the normal food quality during the earlier hours but maybe think twice before going there late.

Went here for a dinner party. When we arrived we had to wait about 2 hours for a table because it was about 13-15 of us. When we were seated we had the waiters Kemisha  and nick. They were helpful but kemisha did seem like she had a little attitude but I guess that was because it was late. The sprite soda was very flat. They kept bringing the bread out which was a good thing because that the food took forever to come out. I ordered the steak Diane medium well, with a side of Mac and cheese, my friend ordered the jambalaya and the salmon. We also had 2 drinks. The Georgia peach was okay just didn&#39;t seem like there was alcohol in it just tasted like mostly juice.

Inside the Aventura mall..I think it was like 50 different kinds of cheesecakes!! Something to drive you crazy, you have to go and try it. the ambiance very cosy and the personal very nice. Not too expensive very delicious <br><br>Main plate:salmon <br>Dessert: Red velvet cheesecake

Went here for dinner last Saturday! We sat in the exterior restaurant patio area. It was clean and no flies! Big plus! Our sever was friendly and attentive. I ordered water with lemon, sweet potato fries and a yummy seared tuna salad. It was delicious, indeed! Especially since I&#39;m trying to add more diets into my menu. <br>The location is prime in Aventura and I really liked the mall that the restaurant was attached to. <br>My negatives are that the wings my Mom ordered came out as buffalo (too spicy for her) instead of plain, and she didn&#39;t want to have it sent back. Also, that it felt a little crowded on the patio and I was bumped a few times by other customers.<br>I&#39;d go back...and definitely try eating inside!

Honestly, I love Cheesecake Factory in any place. First time here aventura locaTion and delicious as always. I love pasta  and the my girlfriend and I always asked fir pasta. My favorite one  is the lasagna verde. Amazing!!! The portions are big enough to eat 2 people, but we always try to eat it all. Always, try to save space for their amazing cheesecakes where they offer different flavors and good to share. Service good as always.

You can&#39;t really go wrong with Cheesecake factory, with their huge menu selection and limitless cheesecakes options, but unfortunately nothing is perfect.<br><br>Had lunch here today and was definitely looking forward to it. <br><br>I got a chicken sandwich with chipotle mayo sauce and it was wonderful. The fried chicken breast was massive and the sauce went perfectly with it. Very filling, crispy, and juicy chicken! The fries that came in with it, were a bit cold and stale though.<br><br>My friend ordered the chicken Romano with alfredo sauce. The chicken itself was actually pretty bland and didn&#39;t have the flavor it should have had. The pasta was very undercooked, very yellow, with barely any alfredo sauce.<br><br>Our server asked us if we&#39;d like a new batch since that one was clearly poorly done, so we did that and it sorta messed up &#34;eating together&#34;<br><br>We let a manager know and he was very nice and understanding about it. Apparently they&#39;re practicing some sort of new way of storing and preparing their pastas. He apologized and made it clear that he&#39;ll get with his staff. <br><br>Personally, I think he could have gone a step further by asking if there is anything he could do for us. Such as a free slice of cheesecake, or a discount of some sort. Due to the inconveniences that had occurred.
Love the patio addition! An absolute great option for outdoor dinning. They now have text paging so you can shop if they have a long wait.

Now I know why this Cheesecake Factory only have 3 starts , service and management are horrible...... I go overthere all the time I finally feel today is the right time to write a review about that store......Appatizer come before the bread witch we ask the waitress twice , the 2 main course come out separate get the pasta witch we had to send back then 15 minutes later the flatbread pizza came out , all these troubles Not even a floor manager come to table..... don&#39;t go there if you not on a good mood.

Server: Nicole S.<br>Beverage: Coke Zero two limes<br>Entree: Lunch portion miso salmon with sautéed spinach <br><br>Sat in the bar area to bypass the wait and there were some empty tables so I sat myself in the corner. I had to wait about 10 minutes before being greeted.<br><br>Once Nicole came to the table &amp; got my drink order, she also went to get me a menu. She appeared in the weeds but it was not too much of a wait, I couldn&#39;t figure out what I wanted to eat so she allowed me to peruse the menu till I was ready. <br><br>The miso salmon is one of my favorite dishes on the menu, it was perfect as always. The spinach was too salty but since I was ravenous, I did eat it all and did not tell Nicole. All in all an adequate dining experience, if we were capable of 1/2 stars, this would be a 4.5 and not a 4.

The cheesecake fasctory in aventura has the worst management. Service and food.  It should be shut down for cleanliness. You asked to respond.  You dont even respond when i am in restraunt. Your male manager is indifferent.  Female manager the same.  I guarantee based on the above. You wont be around in 2022.

Went to cheesecake factory with my friends for the lunch. Ordered Spicy Crispy Chicken Sandwich with fries on the side. We also ordered Barbeque Ranch Chicken Salad in the lunch special. The food was good and the best part was the salad. It was one of the best salads that i had. The service was very slow.

Always great food, big portions, convenient location and excellent cakes! So many options to choose from. I always come here when I feel picky and feel like some huge, delicious salad (Santa Fe Salad!), sweet potato fries, sweet tamales or salmon with mash potatoes and veggies. Those are my go to orders. They also have these delicious desserts that you just can&#39;t get anywhere else. My favourites are Tiramisu Cheesecake (as it&#39;s the least sweet one), Toasted Marshmallow CC (without marshmallows as it makes it super sweet) and their seasonal Pumpkin CC. Also their Red Velvet Cake, Salted Caramel CC, Adam&#39;s PB CC (extremely sweet but so good!) and Hazelnut Crunch will be an option.<br>Always good to remember that their key lime, and lemon cheesecakes are way too sweet. Even if they sound less sweet. Not sure why. I guess they add too much sugar to balance the tartness.

Okay, Cheesecake Factory, you win; you&#39;re getting five stars from me.<br><br>Sure, you&#39;re a chain, and as such, you&#39;re likely to be hit or miss as each location has its own staff and situations going around. I can&#39;t say that with this one though. Well, unless it&#39;s to say you hit it right out of the park.<br><br>Among the many birthday celebrations I had in the past month, holding one here was a great idea. We gathered and were sat immediately.<br><br>Tanya was our waitress and she was a real joy. Her enthusiasm was contagious. That said, we ordered Shepard&#39;s pie, a burger and fries, and of course, some of their signature cheesecake. Specifically the chocolate tuxedo cream one.<br><br>We munched away and had delicious leftovers. Oh, and the staff surprised me singing happy birthday. It was a wonderful night.

Great drinks I have to say. Hopefully when things go back to normal we&#39;ll be able to go back here. Cheesecake always good, hence the name. Our bartender was great. Hope to see her back there. Well worth the time and money.

We go to the Cheesecake Factory quite often.  Its close to us and has a good selection of great foods.  Given the Pandemic they have been doing quite well in terms of service - in fact - much less time to wait for a table if you &#34;eat outside on the patio&#34;.  Additionally they now utilize your phone&#39;s text messaging capability so you can make a reservation without being there.

With everything that&#39;s going on right now this location is doing an amazing job with curbside pickups.<br>The food was as expected we ordered 3 Louisiana Chicken Pasta always good and spicy packed with flavor especially if you love garlic as much as my family does.

I ate here last night with a companion shortly after 10 pm. We were seated promptly despite how busy it seemed. I ordered spaghetti and he ordered a chicken pasta. Overall it was an enjoyable experience dining here. Bread and food arrived promptly. Our waitress was attentive. The overall spirit of the restaurant just felt nice! The portions are huge! So much so that I had couple bites of spaghetti for breakfast and the remainder for lunch today. I&#39;ve been nibbling on my Oreo cheesecake slice I ordered togo throughout the day as well. It&#39;s more chocolatey than I anticipated it to be, but that&#39;s not necessarily a bad thing. The place was what I&#39;d expect from a Cheesecake Factory. To be candid, this was one of very few places open for dining at that hour, but it wasn&#39;t a bad time by any means.

Pretty nice place to stop by for a quick lunch or dinner. Food and service was good and I was pretty happy with my decision to try this place out. Only thing that made my experience less enjoyable is that I was told by hostess that waiting time was 5-10 minutes and after 20 minutes when I walked up to her again to ask why its taking so long - she told me that I have been already called and I missed my table, I asked her is that possible when I was standing few steps away from her all the time I was waiting - and she just told me wait again :/
Fried Cauliflower - tastes like orange chicken from the food court <br>Brussel sprouts - perfect mixture of something sweet, savory, and a little bit of crunch

If you want to spend $14 on a ginger beer + lime juice, come here! I ordered a Moscow Mule, but it was non-alcoholic. Why? Where are we? What fresh hell is this? <br>My sister ordered their strawberry daiquiri. AKA a strawberry smoothie. Non-alcoholic. $12. To be clear, we ordered off the cocktail menu. We assumed they would be standard pours. I politely mentioned to the server that there was virtually no alcohol to be detected by the tongue and she asked if we wanted floaters of vodka. Later, I noticed on our bill that she didn&#39;t charge us for the two floaters. Nice of her, but I wondered, had I not brought it up at all, would we have been swindled with alcoholic charges for two sub-par virgin beverages? Pls no.

I sort of broke my number one travel rule:  Never eat at a place you have at home.  It&#39;s &#34;sort of&#34; because while Maui doesn&#39;t have a Cheesecake Factory, I can get my fix on Oahu, which, by the way, is home to the chain&#39;s highest-grossing location in Waikiki.  There were other restaurants in the Aventura Mall but I didn&#39;t have time to research them and didn&#39;t want to be disappointed so we ended up at a familiar place. <br><br>ATMOSPHERE:<br>It&#39;s a typical CF - tons of seats including outdoor ones.  Even though it was already 3pm, the place was buzzing. <br><br>FOOD:<br>Caesar Salad - $12.95<br>This was very disappointing due to their weak dressing.  There was no zing or creaminess to it, it was just there to provide moisture.  The lettuce was chopped into perfect bite-sized pieces with a few croutons and sprinkled with powder-like parmesan cheese.  Pass. <br><br>Chicken Marsala and Mushrooms - $19.95<br>Even though my spouse makes a better version, we decided to split this as they&#39;re known for their huge portions.  The chicken breasts were surprisingly tender and was smothered in a very buttery and savory gravy.  My only gripe was the minimal amount of mushrooms.  While I&#39;m not a fan of bowtie pasta, I didn&#39;t substitute them for spaghetti/linguine due to a past bad experience where I received a substantial amount of noodles and very little chicken marsala.  Highly recommended.  <br><br>DESSERT:<br>Salted Caramel Cheesecake - $8.95<br>I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake but I love the Factory&#39;s version as they&#39;re so light and not dense.  My spouse opted for this flavor which was too sweet for my liking.  I&#39;d have preferred the banana or strawberry topping but I can&#39;t have it my way every time!  LOL. <br><br>SERVICE:<br>Regardless of the busyness, we got seated within 5 minutes.  Host service was  welcoming and friendly.  <br><br>Our gal server was very good.  Nice personality, professional and checked on us throughout.  <br><br>OVERALL:<br>When in doubt, go with a familiar brand!

We ate in the bar area, as the wait for a regular dinner table was 30 minutes on a Labor Day afternoon. The server was super busy and we kept having to ask him for help. <br><br>The warm bread was good but we had to ask for butter. For dinner, we ordered the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps and Meatloaf. The wraps were made super fresh and came with three different sauces. The meatloaf was terrible with fried onions and in a sweet salty sauce put all over on top on ten pieces--it tasted awful.  It was also overcooked. <br><br>We had the Carrot Cake and it wasn&#39;t that fresh, it was pretty dry. I&#39;ve had much better cake on other visits. <br><br>I don&#39;t like the layout of this place as it seems very cramped, and it was just chaos on Labor Day.

Horrible service yesterday with Cheesecake Factory!! I order takeout and my order wasn&#39;t complete. Then I called the restaurant to speak to a manager and they hand me on hold for over 30 mins, 3 times to speak to a manager and supposedly they was busy!! I don&#39;t understand during today&#39;s time how busy the managers  when there&#39;s no one in the restaurant. However, it was horrible service of all these years going to Cheesecake Factory I have never had this bad of service!! I finally spoke to a manager he was apologetic but didn&#39;t really do anything for me the customer! So I will never order from this cheesecake again!

I definitely love two things about this place and it is the brown bread and the Fettuchine Alfredo, the sauce is delicious, super creamy, the pasta is soft and it is worth adding chicken, I usually always order the pasta, my mom ordered the Thai chicken and  I must say that I was surprised with the flavor, the mixture of flavors is very good, strong but rich, the rice that accompanied it came simple without flavor but perfect to combine with the dish<br><br>Definitivamente me encantan dos cosas de este lugar y es el pan café y el Fettuchine Alfredo, la salsa es delicosa, super cremosa, la pasta es suave y vale la pena adicionarle pollo, usualmente siempre ordeno la pasta, mi mama pidio el pollo Thai y debo decir que quede sorprendida con el sabor, la mezcla de sabores es muy buena, fuerte pero rica, el arroz que lo acompañaba venia simple   sin sabor pero perfecto para combianar con el plato

I&#39;m truly not one to ever post a review on here, if I do it&#39;s because it was really amazing or really bad. Where do I start, my daughter and I came for lunch, this please used to be my daughter&#39;s favorite place to eat ever since she was about 7 or so, we stopped coming for awhile because the service and the food started becoming like walking in a Fridays, the silver is not polished water marks on everything, or just possibly dirty, either this needs to be addressed by management, seating out mostly all chairs has bird droppings on them, and then you cook a medium rare steak to medium well to well done, today my server was actually decent, but I will say this is the last chance I&#39;m giving this place and it sucks because this used to be one of my favorite places to come, with my daughter and friends and even dates, I hope the management reads this and makes the necessary changes to bring back the cheesecake that I used to know and love, or what people expect from the Cheesecake Factory, by the no manager visit to the table either. You&#39;ve lost a loyal customer Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;m just one but if this decline continues, I can you your sales dropping drastically. Have a great day.

To start, we were brought out bread with mold on it. We had a very kind server who kept apologizing for that. The manager came out and only offered a free dessert for the inconvenience. I do not know how an establishment would not go above and beyond in service after you realized one person at the table took a bite of bread which was tied to the one with mold. The manager then proceeded to ask if we wanted to keep the other bread that touched the mold. This was a first for me at a restaurant. Would not recommend. Very disappointed and not comfortable with going to The Cheesecake Factory during COVID.

We are ALL suffering from Covid-19, but to hear Cheesecake Factory&#39;s plan to stop paying rent is (as a landlord)...just wrong. No loans or bail outs for property owners...some of whom only have one or two tenants. <br>Your company gets virtually free money from the government...and then you take advantage of anyone you can.  Never Cheesecake Factory.

I was there on December 30th <br>And I can understand how busy could be restaurant during holiday season. But! <br>There was a huge waiting line. I was by myself so my table was ready in 5-7 min. <br>I ordered burger (medium rare) and Fries. I was waiting for my order 45minutes!!! And it was absolutely terrible. Beef was so dry and wasn&#39;t even close to medium rare. It was overcooked and looked like it was staying in the kitchen Lon long time. Also they brought different fries a so my lunch was ruined. Of course I didn&#39;t change my order because I didn&#39;t want to wait another 45 min. <br><br>Disappointed.

I&#39;ve been to the cheesecake factory many times over the last 20yrs. I am not a frequent guest because I prefer to eat at local eateries but I&#39;ll stop by when i occasionally crave one of their dishes and I happen to be going to the mall.<br><br>I have been craving a good Cobb salad for awhile and I am a blue cheese dressing snob so I figured that the cheesecake factory would have a great salad. I also had to go to the mall so i made it my Saturday -treat myself out lunch meal. <br><br>I know how busy this location is and was surprised that I only had to wait five minutes for a table outside. They sat me at the table next to the door the servers go in and out of. Every time the door opened I got a good gust of cold wind come my way so after about 30 minutes...I asked if I could be moved. Now, I had ordered my salad by then and was happily drinking the Green iced tea and eating their delicious bread.<br><br>The manager came by quickly after my request and moved me to another table, it was on the other side of the patio, but still within view of my previous table, in my server&#39;s view. That was the last time I saw her. I sat there for awhile waiting for my salad, watching some Netflix show on my phone, and a new episode began to play, and still no salad. I saw three servers take care of the tables directly adjacent to mine, but nobody once glanced my way...I thought I must&#39;ve been wearing an invisibility cloak...After unsuccessfully trying to get their attention I finally got up and walked to where all of the servers were standing at and asked if someone could help me...once again, no response...the only person who looked my way was a busser and he said he would go look for my salad.<br><br>Next, I went back up to the manager and she apologized and I got my salad soon after.<br><br>One of the servers next to me finally half paid attention to my table and then I asked for my check and she took my credit card to my first server who I hadn&#39;t seen since I moved tables. After waiting another 20+ minutes to get my credit card back I had to get up again and look for my server, I didn&#39;t find her so I stood there waiting...the manager happened to be passing by and I told her what had happened...she apologized. And offered to comp my meal...<br><br>Yeah, she comped my meal but my day was ruined. I would rather pay for my meal and not have to go chasing my server and wait 45-50 minutes for a salad. This was, hands down one of the worst experiences I&#39;ve ever had at a restaurant. <br><br>The only good thing I have to say is that the blue cheese dressing was superb, but the whole experience didn&#39;t allow me to enjoy my meal. I will forgo visiting this cheesecake factory again.

This is one of the restaurant I always visited long time ago that I love it. Is all different with a huge selection of food and of course cheesecake dessert.<br>This time went with my kids after shopping at Aventura Mall. <br>Line was huge but we choose first available seating and only we wait 6 minutes.<br>Service was excellent, I ordered Thai lettuce wrap, came first than my kids food and the manager pass by and see it and ask what my kids order and apologize for. And right away bring the cheeseburger they ordered.<br>General the food was excellent, overral love this specific restaurant. Recommend 100%
I live this place good selection and they have my favorite drink- the cucumber martini <br>However the buffalo bites are nothing to rave about but the Louisiana pasta is

Located in the Aventura Mall the parking is not so bad and the waiting time is good. They have two seating choices inside and outside so we selected the outside tables. The tables were located with enough space in between so you don&#39;t hit other customers chais. Their menus are extensive, and the actual menu (book) needs some cleaning these are  greasy and dirty. However, the food is tasty, well prepared and in general very good, now the server was very attentive and friendly so you won&#39;t be disappointed.<br><br>In short, this is a good place to have a good time and share an excellent meal with your friends or family.

Went there and the meal comes out at the same time as the appetizers and the bread and drinks. When I spoke to the waiter they said well that&#39;s how it came out. We have been coming to cheese cake factory for years I can&#39;t believe the service fallen off. I feel that I will not bring my family back or recommend solely because the service

Update: as of 2/24/19 no reply from Cheesecake Factory, i have to say i am shocked that a company with resources such as theirs has such a lag in their customer care department. Maybe this one is just falling on deaf ears or they don&#39;t want to engage me because sometimes it really is hard to just say sorry. Since their lack of reply, they have a total lack in revenue from me so the only loser so far is Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The food was fine. The service was fine. I&#39;m writing today to complain about the manager on duty and the cleanliness of the restaurant. <br><br>We were 5 people but the genius host decided to take us to a table for 4. Normally this could be accepted if the restaurant was overly busy (or we were actually a party of 4) but it was right at opening so more than half the tables were open. In fact, they were so empty they had sections that were &#34;closed&#34; whatever that means. I wish i could my business under that pretense of &#34;clopened&#34;. I&#39;m sure the folks at Cheesecake Factory corporate offices probably think when their restaurant is open it&#39;s fully open not partially open but they can decide that aspect.<br><br>The hospitality industry is about being hospitable. When I asked to speak with a manager about putting us at a table for 5 they said we would have to sit inside or squeeze into 4 as the mall doesn&#39;t allow 5 tops for fire code and the other section outside that could accommodate our group was closed. <br><br>Having spent over 20 years in this business I have never heard of this policy. I had a professional career working for BR GUEST Hospitality and Starr Restaurants and a Masters in Hospitality Industry Studies (yes I have a masters for some crazy reason in this crazy business) and i have never heard of such lunacy. Yes you have to keep pathways clear but tables that are next to each other can certainly move to create larger tables. <br><br>I also have copied a picture of my bread plate, my spoon, and the salt shaker to let you know that the place is filthy and it&#39;s probably the same manager in charge of this. <br><br>I hope cheesecake reaches out to me because I would love to hear their position. The manager could really use a class in guest relations too. What a putz. He literally just found every reason to say no. This business is about finding a way to say yes.
My first time ordering the red velvet cheese cake. While eating a strand of brown long hair was found in the center of the cake. Felt real disappointed

Nice lunch food was fresh and the service was excellent. The restaurant itself was very clean and comfortable tables. <br><br>The factory is always packed no matter what day of the week it is. But the service is always excellent and the staff is professional at all locations.

Best cheese cake and carrot cake I&#39;ve had. Because this place is located inside aventura mall, it can be very busy. Be prepare to wait at least 20 to 30 min. However, their cheese cake is the worth the wait.

The bar area of the Aventura locations needs a serious cleaning. That, or a renovation. I&#39;ve gone less than a handful of times when done with work and opt to sit in the bar area for faster service but it constantly smells. And not of anything good. A mixture of dead rodent and dirty mop while trying to have an after work cocktail is an extreme turn off. It leaves me to pick up my things and go across the way to another restaurant. Sadly.

Sunday lunch at Cheesecake Factory is always a plus for me especially at the bar. No waiting in a line and service is great.<br>By the bar you can catch a game or even enjoy HH.<br>I love the complimentary bread with butter it comes nice and warm and is always fresh.<br><br>I usually have the popcorn shrimp but this time I enjoyed their thai lettuce tacos from the skinny menu. Everything on the this menu is  under 500 calories and tastes great.<br>My love also enjoyed the pasta that was under the skinny menu and was just the right portion. You don&#39;t feel overwhelmed and guilty from over indulging.<br>The service was great and we ended up watching the dolphin game and ordering two amstel lights before shopping.<br>The prices are reasonable, the food is great Including service.

Ordered a pick up online, 2 adult entrees, one kids and a slice of cheesecake. Asked for utensils and bread. Upon arriving and picking up the order I asked again for those items and was assured everything was in the bag. But only the food I ordered was there, no bread, no utensils, not a single napkin. The food was good though, especially the cheesecake.

Who doesn&#39;t like Cheesecake Factory? It&#39;s a solid four stars! Huge menu including a skinnydelicious  selection which is 590 calories or less. They have salads, sandwich, full dinners and a Sunday brunch you can always find something to eat here. Let&#39;s not forget their amazing cheesecakes and other desserts.<br><br>We got there just at 12 noon so the wait was only 5 minutes and we ate outside. We ordered the Chinese chicken salad lunch portion which was plenty to eat. We also had a turkey burger from the skinny menu which came with a salad. Both were very good. As soon as we sat down our server brought us fresh brown bread with butter. The service was great and the prices are very fair.

The restaurant was very busy took about 2 hour to be seated,the food was very good however one of our orders the shrimp taste burnt and the noodles where incorrect. The waitress refused to remove the item however the manager did.The chicken and dumpling was good,shepherds pie,spaghetti and meatballd,tacos,salmon,pizza and pasta noodles with alfrefa sauce great .

I hadn&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in years, and frankly it wasn&#39;t my first choice when my friend and I had to pick where to dine after a movie.<br><br>But I was pleasantly surprised that they had many healthy options. Something I never thought went together with the name of the restaurant lol.<br><br>I was happy with my vegan &#34;cobb&#34; salad and my friend was happy with her sliders, not vegan ;)<br><br>I removed a star because of the service. Once they brought our food, the server never came by to see if we needed anything or if everything was ok.<br><br>But if you are in Aventura mall and are leaving a late movie AND your vegan, don&#39;t be afraid to check this place out :)

I normally really love going to cheesecake but this time I did not have a good time there. I ordered the avocado rolls and they were absolute awful, and the sauce that came with it was worse. My waiter would always be no where to be seen when ever i needed him to either order extra stuff, more water, or even just get the check. The rest of my food was good tho. I really think they should update their avocado reciple because this one gross
Mediocre food. The Greek salad was inedible<br> Sent it back. The angel hair pasta was.dry.and shrimp was overcooked.

I&#39;ll make this short...but I was not impressed with this location AT ALL.<br><br>As soon as you walk inside it&#39;s absolutely freezing (so sit outside.) the hostess was not welcoming at all. We walked up and this was her exact words... &#34;how many&#34;? 2. &#34;In or out?&#34; We&#39;d like to sit outside. &#34;It&#39;ll be by 5 mins stand over there&#34; <br><br>Then our server outside was so dry. He gave us only the wheat bread when I literally go to Cheesecake Factory for the sourdough...he was like &#34;we ran out&#34;. We wanted the stuffed chicken tortillas come to find out they no longer have it in the menu. Great. Then the server was just so slow the entire time, when he knew we had a movie to get to. <br><br>Just an all around bad experience. Save your time and money and go around the corner to Grand Lux. Thank me later.

After a long wait, we finally got our table. The waiter apparently had too many tables and was hardly around. The bread was hard, cold and the butter hard as a rock. As the food started arriving, a burger came without the cheese, it was sent back with a slice of cheese just thrown on top(cold). Another plate, the mashed potatoes were cold, not even room temperature. I will show a picture of another burger in which you can appreciate the size of the meat in comparison with the bun, small. The waiter showed no apology nor sign of wanting to make up for the lack of attention or missplating the food.

I can&#39;t even explain how tasty and delicious their avocados wraps eggrolls are. I had to order two platters. Absolutley amazing.  You just have to try them to see what im talking about. Then their is desserts.. just wow

They poor judgement on our part we arrived at 4:30pm on a Sat afternoon!<br>Really busy staff scrambled to accommodate 10-15 waiting guests poorly <br>End up in the bar at a dirty table <br>Ordered Classic Shrimp Scampi - pasta was not cooked <br>2nd batch tasted great but service was mediocre!

Had an amazing meal here tonight 2/13/20 thanks to our wonderful waiter ED. His customer service was exceptional. He was attentive and very knowledgable about the menu! For those trying to eat here, I recommend the steak tacos, tomato basil pasta (comes with chicken), truffle honey chicken and hummus with pita chips.

Cheesecake Factory is always a great place to end the night. The staff is always very friendly, and if the wait&#39;s too long, you can look for an open table in the bar area. <br><br>Food is usually on point being it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory and desserts are always a great plus. I usually order the Teriyaki Chicken, bone in and it&#39;s always good. I&#39;ve also ordered a steak one time but it wasn&#39;t so great. I fault myself for that being that this isn&#39;t a steak place, and so I should save those cravings for another place I enjoy going to. <br><br>My favoite desserts are the Banana Cheesecake and the Tiramisu Dessert (not cheesecake)
The best place for an American burger!<br>Came here with my friend Fabio who was craving Cheesecake, it did not disappoint! I am in heaven right now and I love the cheesecake !

Always busy plan to wait! At the bar you have first come first serve. Happy hour is great! Service is good even with so many people. You can always sit at the bar to avoid the wait. Tables are too close to each other not a good private dining place.

We came here because we were shopping at Aventura Mall, my hubby received a gift card from a coworker and we decided to go ahead and give it a try. <br><br>This was my second time eating at a cheesecake factory and will be my last. I didn&#39;t like it the first time and I definitely didn&#39;t like it this time.   <br><br>I can not complain about the service because it was good. Waitress was quick and on her game.<br><br>BUT the food was awful which I expected, even before tasting it, because of the extensive menu.    Pages and pages of food. From American, to Italian, to Asian, etc....  Too much...<br><br>The only good thing on our plates was the mashed potatoes and let&#39;s be honest, how difficult is it to mess up mashed potatoes.....<br><br>My hubby&#39;s shrimp was overcooked (so chewy) and his steak was tough. <br>My food was bland, to say the least.    <br><br>My advice to Cheesecake Factory: Stick to one thing and do it well...
The worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been, the host was rude . She even cursed at me <br>Will never come here again.
Avocado eggrolls bring me here every single time)) simply perfect cheesecake and attentive and timely service

We were early so there was no wait for a table. Service was fairly fast also. Although the waiter seemed a bit snotty.<br><br>I ordered off the &#34;skinny&#34; menu (under 590 calories section) and got a turkey sandwich with bacon, avocado, tomato on a roll. I asked for no mayo but it came with mayo so I deconstructed it. Sorry, no photo! There was also a side &#34;salad&#34; - a small dish of greens topped with some sort of dressing. <br>It tasted fine.<br><br>My companion liked his regular chopped salad -- said he&#39;d order it again. See photo.<br><br>Interesting when your server gets more friendly the closer to the tip it is. Hmmmm..
My chicken Cabonara was amazing! Weight time was only 5 minutes for a Saturday night. I definitely would recommend the Cinabon cheesecake. It&#39;s extremely sweet, but wonderful to share.

Had a difficult time getting service here. Flagging down our waiter was an adventure although he was very nice. Food was standard Cheesecake Factory, good taste and great portions! Had to ask for the bread while we waited for food. Cheesecake of course can&#39;t be beat, but this location just seems a bit run down and understaffed.

Usually favorite place to go, love going to Cheesecake Factory in Naples FL! <br>Made the trip all the way to Aventura from south Miami  to have some cheesecake. <br> I&#39;m the biggest fan of red velvet cheesecake and I&#39;m always highly satisfied with it in Naples but here I was disappointed. The cheesecake and red velvet part was dry and tasted like it was old. <br>I would maybe give it another try but I&#39;d really hope for fresh cheesecake!!

First of all, I&#39;m obsessed with food (my mom&#39;s a chef), so I know some people will maybe make fun of me for giving this place four stars. But hey... it&#39;s a guilty pleasure.<br><br>I like this place, a lot. I went to the one in Aventura Mall a couple of of days ago, and I was looking forward to it, because I don&#39;t live in the US and haven&#39;t been to one in a long time.<br><br>The wait time (to my surprise) was short. The server was so-so, but when the bread came, it all started to get better. The butter was way to cold so it didn&#39;t taste of much. Oh, we were also seated below a light where the lightbulb was flickering and it was kind of annoying, but it&#39;s not like it happens a lot (I&#39;m assuming).<br><br>We were only two people at the table so we decided to order one appetizer and one main course to share, because the portions are famously huge. We ordered the Warm Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip and a Thai Coconut-Lime Chicken with Rice and Grilled Vegetables and they were both very, very good. They felt comforting and were very flavorful.<br><br>After we were done with those we (obviously) felt the need to order cheesecake. I&#39;m not very proud of the one we ordered, I think it was called Celebration, and it looked like a Unicorn made it for a girl&#39;s birthday party. But, I have to admit, it wasn&#39;t bad (it wasn&#39;t amazing either). It was made with a vanilla sponge cake with layers of different flavored mousses (vanilla, chocolate and strawberry) and a cream cheese frosting... and some multicolored sprinkles as well (I know, very weird). But as I said, it was tasty... though I might have convince myself it was good so I wouldn&#39;t feel I messed up my dessert order at the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Overall, I enjoyed it, had fun, didn&#39;t spend that much and left feeling full... extremely full considering two people ordered 3 dishes overall.

Came in with my family for our usual Sunday dinner we didn&#39;t have a reservation but were sat right away.<br>We sat for 20min before the server even came to the table, he was extremely dry and mumbled his name (Caesar) <br>Since we had plenty of time waiting for him we had our whole order ready. He brought our drinks to the table on a tray and put the whole dirty tray on our table it was very unsettling. <br>We had to beg him for bread once he brought it out finally I asked what his name was since he mumbled it the first time he said his name was Omar. We never got any refills by the time we were done he asked us to stack the plates so he can take  them And asked if we want anything eles we said yes and just need a Little time to decide on what cheesecake we wanted .. he seemed annoyed that we didn&#39;t know what we wanted yet. Once he came back to the table and asked again what we want.. we said no we&#39;re fine we will just take the check he said &#34;fine give me the menus then&#34; very rudely. He made us very uncomfortable we just wanted to leave. We looked at the check to see the servers name and it said Cesar. Seem like he gave us a false name cause he knew he was giving very poor service.  The only good thing was the food it&#39;s always so good just wish we had a friendly server. I recommend not sitting with &#34;Caesar&#34; or &#34;Omar&#34; whatever his name is.

Eating here today was overall a bad experience. We were a table of 5 and waited 40-55 minutes for our food to come after hearing the cook burned our artichoke. I had fish and chips and they were very bad. They were soggy and mushy. On the contrary, the cheesecake was amazing. Everything was perfect about it and I loved it. <br><br>Pros<br>1. Cheesecake<br>2. French fries<br>3. Nice area<br>4. Bread<br><br>Cons<br>1. Fish and chips<br>2. Service<br><br>that&#39;s my experience

This is my daughter&#39;s place to celebrate. So after her musical recital she choose the Cheesecake Factory. The wait was 20minutes. Everyone knows that this restaurant on Sunday afternoon is very popular. The server was very nice and friendly. The food was very good. I ate the Thai chicken lettuce. It was excellent, the three sauces were delicious. My daughter had the pasta with basil and my brother had a Phillip Steak Sandwich. Everything was very great. Of course for dessert we had a s&#39;mores cheesecake! A #winner yum yum!!

THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I ordered a Filet medium, it came out well done, I sent it back, waited another 20 minutes starving of course and I got horrible &#34;filet&#34; chewy, gristly, tough! I ate a couple of bites because I was starving and told the server . She called the manager I think his name was Alejandro and he apologized and comped our $3 ICED TEA and offered a complimentary desert because he could not give me discount for the steak . <br>I don&#39;t need your desert! I came here hungry , I was waiting for 40 minutes to get a $30 shitty steak and I could not even eat it. I am in the business, I know exactly how good service should they provide for these mistakes. Thank you for your horrible service I will never come back.

In my opinion Cheesecake factory is great for the variety that they provide in their menu with pricing being a little above average. What blows me away is their pasta in the variety of styles they can provide such as topping with parmesan crusted chicken, chicken marsala, or the creamy carbonara. All their sauces and spices work great together and I would pick any pasta and be satisfied. Also, their Cheesecake is to die for.<br>However, the main thing I&#39;m not crazy about Cheesecake factory are their burgers. I think they are satisfactory but no competition for burger joints. Still, I understand that they are providing a huge menu with many great options so you really can&#39;t knock a place over just that.

This is a review for the Cheesecake Factory Happy Hour offerings in the bar at their location inside Aventura Mall. <br><br>They reeled me in with a Mojito for $5.50.<br><br>The best happy hour food were the fried chicken sliders. There were at least four reasonably sized sliders. They arrived very hot, freshly fried. Aventura&#39;s chicken sliders were more substantial than Dadeland Mall&#39;s chicken sliders I tried a few weeks later. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t recommend the &#34;Vietnamese&#34; summer rolls. They must be made way in advance because the rice paper became very white and hard. Ideally the wrapper should be dipped and rolled just before serving, so that it&#39;s still soft and chewy when eaten.<br><br>The pork eggrolls, artichoke dip, and ahi tuna tartare were okay. Overall, the portions of most of the Happy Hour foods at this location are bigger than Dadeland&#39;s Cheesecake Factory.
Nice place to have Lunch or Dinner with Friends! Like the appetizers, drinks and steak.

Filthy. Dirty table, dirty silverware, greasy menus. Restrooms smell worse than a portable toilet at a campground. Definitely lost my appetite. Extremely disgusted, not Cheesecake Factory Standards at all. <br>We eat at Cheesecake Factory frequently, and after this experience I will never return to the Aventura location for sure.

We got good service, good food. Expected. Price with drinks and tip $75...not too bad for CCF. The place is always and packed but clean. This is one of the best CCFs I&#39;ve been too. Great location at the mall at Aventura. No deserts today. Venture to order something you&#39;ve never tried before to make it interesting. Otherwise, it&#39;s just another classic. Bathrooms were nasty. Gotta tidy up.

Do not go to the restroom here prior to eating . It literally smelled like a rest stop bathroom. I understand Aventura is a popular mall, lots of tourists , lots of foot traffic , but the bathroom literally reeked. I wish I could offer a food review, but I had zero appetite after using the restroom . Beyond disgusting .

I ordered the shrimp scampi to go and I never knew that the shrimp scampi don&#39;t come <br>with pasta:( They carelessly did not put pasta!<br> I do not understand this. How can you forget pasta in shrimp scampi??? The really bad part about this is that they wrote my name on the top SEE THROUGH LID still did not notice that it was ONLY shrimp with no pasta in the Dam container!!!! I&#39;m baffled by this!!! They are just careless and not paying attention to anything Due to rushing &amp; not double checking the food!!  (I ate some of my shrimp)
Service excellent<br>Lettuce wrap two little chicken<br>Tuna Poke big disappointing, too spicy very little tuna

I come here all the time. I usually have chicken. The chicken Bellagio, Chicken Madeira, Chicken Marsala, Crusted Chicken Romano or the Crispy Chicken  Costoletta are all great. I usually choose from one of those dishes and when it&#39;s lunch time like now I get a grilled chicken sandwich on the wheat bread with mushrooms and onions. Always delicious and flavorful.<br>Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant they have everything you can want and more!

Terrible customer service. It&#39;s been the second time witnessing disgusting treatment while having my lunch at this place. <br><br>I went to the restaurant with my colleague. Besides getting appetizers, I ordered a breakfast burrito and specifically said &#34;no meat&#34; while ordering. The issue is not in the fact that the waitress forgot about it, but in the way she handled the issue. After all, we all make mistakes. When I was given the burrito, I double checked, just to make sure, it doesn&#39;t have meat. Her reaction was &#34;Oh now you don&#39;t want none&#34;, and then added &#34;We don&#39;t have burritos with no meat.&#34; On top of that, she was trying to walk away like it was nothing, and of course I told her I can&#39;t eat that. She took the plate in the most disrespectful way and mumbling she needs to put in another order for me. I walked up to her and told her that I don&#39;t need the meal anymore. You had to see her face expression in this whole situation.<br><br>I mean all you had to do is say &#34;Sorry about that, we can put in another order or do you like me to cancel&#34; and that would have been very appreciative. <br><br>This is my 2nd incident in 4 times coming here. Thank you, but never again.

Cheesecake Factory is a restaurant that we are all pretty much familiar with. They have a HUGE menu offering MANY different kinds of dishes. There is something to please everyone on the menu. The food is always tasty and the portions are unbelievably big. In my opinion it&#39;s enough to share with someone else. Today we had lunch and at first I must say that this particular location at the Aventura Mall is ALWAYS ALWAYS packed! It&#39;s rare if you can get a table right away. We waited about 20 mins before we were seated. As we sat down the first thing my husband noticed was his fork had a dark green piece of lettuce stuck to it!  Beyond gross!! So I looked down and checked the rest of the silverware and mine had some kind of food still stuck on it . Beyond Gross!!! As soon as the waitress came back I pointed it out to her and she apologized and grabbed all the silverware and took it straight to the GM she was extremely bothered by it and had him come to our table and excuse themselves. She brought us some clean, fresh silverware. After that we just tried to get over it and just order, because at this point we are just hungry and want to eat. To start off we had the Calamari and Mac &amp; Cheese Balls as appetizers- My husband ordered the Carne Asada with rice, my daughter ordered her usual 4 cheese pasta and I tried the Skinny Asian Chicken Salad. The food was good everyone enjoyed their plates and I liked the salad. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive to our needs, no complaints on that end. After our meals we were full and just ordered some desserts to go. ( Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake, Chocolate Cake and a Mango Key Lime Cheesecake) not pictures bc they were packed to go- but they were delicious as always. I rated this particular Cheesecake Factory at this location 3 stars, because of the cleanliness issues.
The food is delicious! However, Aventura location ALWAYS gets my Togo orders WRONG  and most of the time the server is very unapologetic... It&#39;s an inconvenience to me

Overall I recommend eating at the Cheesecake Factory.<br>I ordered the Mac and cheese but it was a bit too watery. Next time I&#39;m sticking to my usual, the sliders. The sliders are really good. I&#39;d recommend getting that. <br>The service is alright. The atmosphere is nice though it can get a bit loud at some points.
Soy glazed edamame with little pieces of caramelized ginger is a must try !<br>This place is always consistent and always good for lunch.

Never know what your actually going to get. Got sat down at 7:30, waited 15 minutes, did not get greeted at all. Decided to go to another restaurant. Not the first time this has happened. Only reason I go is because I live right next door, starting to over this place.
After my party of 15 waiting from 2pm, it was 5:30pm and after 3 visits from the manager stating they were getting the tables ready we had to leave.<br><br>They will never see me again.

Went out to the factory Sunday night and got the worst service in my entire life, our server sat us down took our orders and never came back, didn&#39;t even refill our drinks! After 1 hour 30 minutes of watching her serve everybody around us. We finally was at our wits end and walked out, when a couple that came in 30 minutes after us received their appetizers before us. Good Service is a Lost Art in Miami that&#39;s why nobody tips! Cheesecake factory in Aventura Mall is all about making money without showing customers true service, that&#39;s why I typically stay away from food chains.

Although the food has been good, it&#39;s not a good food safety practice for this restaurant chain to permit dogs to eat and sit in the inside areas of the restaurant. We found a group of people with their non-service dog being completely inconsiderate with other customers by bringing a dog inside - a dog that can beg for food, urinate, or defecate next to your table while you&#39;re trying to enjoy a meal. Management decided to do nothing and not confront the entitled patrons that were thinking only of themselves by bringing their dog inside. The dog party stayed; we chose to leave. When will Cheesecake Factory stop this, when we can see dog piss streaming down the dessert case or when someone slips on dog waste and falls?

My server was tony and he was great. I told him that I haven&#39;t been to cheesecake in a long time and he helped me pick out drinks and food. It was best and easiest experience I&#39;ve had at a restaurant. Thanks so much cheesecake for hiring tony
10stars for Desi at the bar!!! She was amazinggggggg super attentive super fast super friendly, definitely going back to her!!
Service is the worst here, they don&#39;t train servers. Management is not customer friendly. Their responses come with a big attitude. <br><br>They really need to revaluate the way they train

I would like to start off by saying I have been working in restaurants since I was a teenager and I&#39;m never one to complain because I understand the industry, but there was a serious lack of professionalism at this location. I came in with my family a party of 7 and a newborn for my sisters birthday dinner. First I stood at the hostess stand for AT LEAST 3-5 minutes listening to the 3 hostesses talk about their personal life before being asked &#34;oh do you need something?&#34; No hi, how are you or how many is in your party, nothing. I told her we had 7 and a baby and she with attitude said 30 minutes then when handing me the buzzer said now it&#39;s 35. I let it go because we were just trying to have a good night. Then when we were finally being seated they told us with a party of 7 and a baby that we had to squeeze into a booth set for 6 when there was plenty of available tables. The hosted said 6? I said no 7 and a baby and she said oh so 8 and walked away. Didn&#39;t help us, didn&#39;t get us to a correct size table, didn&#39;t make sure we were comfortable or correctly set up. Just walked away. We ended up leaving before we ever sat down because no one would help us. There was 3 hostesses and 3 servers standing by, even when we asked they just looked at us. Finally we just left. Then after not being helped and treated terribly, the hostess screamed with a smirk on her face &#34;have a good night&#34; as we were walking out. Not a sincere have a good  night, she clearly didn&#39;t want us there and was happy we were leaving. As I stated before I am a server/bartender and have been a hostess before too. I know how this works. The complete lack of respect given to customers, probably because of its location and it being a high volume restaurant so they don&#39;t care, is unacceptable. We were trying to enjoy a night out as a family with a larger group and our night was completely ruined. We normally love the Cheesecake Factory and the one by our house in fort lauderdale is great, but this location (Aventura mall) could use some improvement. I&#39;m sure if these girls don&#39;t want to do their job there&#39;s plenty of others who will.<br><br>Edit I changed my 1 star review to 3 stars simply for Monica the general manager who contacted me and was absolutely wonderful over the phone. While the hostess may not have been the best the management at the Aventura Cheesecake Factory is top notch.

Discovery of the century! This is my go to place to eat in the USA. The menu is massive. So many choices and apparently it&#39;s all amazing. We started with avocado rolls. Imagine an avocado deep fried in an egg roll shell. Heaven. Mac and cheese balls were equally delicious. For a main I had the Thai shrimp in a coconut chilli sauce that was really good as well. No one was disappointed in their meal. Portions are huge so you&#39;ll have leftovers for the next day. You can&#39;t go wrong eating here...

I had a lovely experience at The Cheesecake Factory in Aventura, FL for my last couple of visits so I figured it was only right for me to complete a review. <br><br>This is a high volume restaurant; most likely because it is located at one of the largest (and best) malls in the area. Please note, you cannot make a reservation nor can you do call ahead seating.  There are certain times where I wouldn&#39;t dare step foot in this restaurant (peak times, weekends). However, my husband and I had a late dinner yesterday ~8:15pm and it wasn&#39;t too bad. <br><br>WATCH OUT when you walk in. On top of patrons trying to enter the restaurant, you will also be amongst the servers going in and out the door! There likely won&#39;t be a place for you to have a seat (waiting area is subpar) but you can get a buzzer and do a little shopping while you wait (I&#39;m unsure how far the pager goes). <br><br>My experience... my husband and I asked for a table of two and had to wait approximately 5 minutes. We were seated next to the kitchen door which is normally extremely frustrating to me but the back of the booth has such a tall divider that I couldn&#39;t even notice. <br><br>Our waitress was most helpful. I ordered strawberry lemonade (which is honestly way too sweet but I had a sweet craving at the time). I always request to only have the wheat bread in our basket because... well, it&#39;s just that darn tasty! We ordered the chicken nachos as a starter (Mm mmm good!) and decided to share the  orange chicken entree. Honestly, all of their entrees are oversized... we try to make good decisions! <br><br>Service was great. Food was DELISH!

I&#39;ve been to this particular Cheesecake Factory numerous times through out the years and it hasn&#39;t really changed.  In relation to where this restaurant is located it is a part of Aventura Mall at the southern east mall entrance between Sears and Bloomingdale&#39;s.  <br><br>There is an entrance also from inside the mall beside Trattoria Rosalia&#39;s not far from the Apple Store and the 8 star pointed fountain.<br><br>While the service at the Cheesecake Factory always seems to be good there are some things here that could use improvement.  The outdoor seating for example, when it rains there are a lot of seats available but some seem to get slightly wet.  If they could do a better job covering those tables perhaps they would be able to be used all the time.  There are fans above the covered area so I&#39;m guessing they don&#39;t want those to get wet considering they use electricity.  Somehow, perhaps protect those tables from getting wet so they aren&#39;t left idle and more people can use them.<br><br>Another issue is the inside waiting space.  It&#39;s very small, the bar is also very small compared to other Cheesecake factories I&#39;ve been to.  Lots of people are willing to wait for tables to eat at this place.  There really needs to be some more accommodation for them somehow so they aren&#39;t all cramped in that dim area.<br><br>The bar being small is sort of closed off from the waiting area and other areas have glass partitions.  This particular restaurant just seems more closed off than others we&#39;ve been to.  I get that you want privacy but this Cheesecake Factory just seems cramped.  I don&#39;t necessarily get the same feeling from say the one at Cocowalk.<br><br>The food is the same here as it is at the other Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to which means it&#39;s good food, big portions and large everything except for space on the table.<br><br>One piece of advice, don&#39;t eat the bread.   You&#39;re going to most likely get full off just your main dish so apps are also a trap.  Don&#39;t eat bread or apps if you want cheesecake for dessert but don&#39;t forget you can always take your food home with you too.<br><br>One more thing, this place can get pretty stuffy inside at times.  It&#39;s almost like the AC can&#39;t keep up with all the people generating heat in this place.  I changed my table from first available to inside just because it was way too humid outside to enjoy dinner.

3.5:  you know how, when you order a pizza with more than 2 people, nobody can agree on the toppings? That&#39;s where a place like CF comes in: there&#39;s something for everyone, because the menu is huge (as are the portions). <br><br>It&#39;s funny that a place with a name focusing on dessert (cheesecake), serves food in such large sizes that you are nearly certain NOT to have room for dessert. Even if you share, it seems any cheesecake you order will be &#34;to go&#34;. <br><br>Food snobs would not even stoop to review a chain restaurant, but I live in Aventura (basically), and I feel a civic duty to tourists to paint a full picture of my home turf. And CF is really not that bad. There is variety, value (items are not cheap, but big - lending easily to sharing or a second leftover meal), it&#39;s good for families, it&#39;s in a mall (you&#39;ll be there anyway, so if you want something a step up from food court...), and it&#39;s worth a try if you are a tourist from a place that doesn&#39;t have an outpost (I&#39;m thinking here of my fellow Canadians). <br><br>I say 3.5 because I think it has more appeal than next door &#34;Grill on the Alley&#34; for the reasons in the previous paragraph. I also think it is a slight step up from sister restaurant &#34;Grand Luxe Cafe&#34; (same ownership, also with an outpost at Aventura Mall), which has a less interesting menu.

I was extremely disappointed on Sunday December 9th. The bathrooms were disgusting, extremely dirty.  Paper all over the floor, water all over the floor.  The water all over counter and floor.  My husbsnd said it was worst in mens bathroom.<br>And you would think with all the tourist and locals that are going to Aventura Mall  the Cheesecake would be clean. CHEESECAKE should have someone assigned to keep it clean.  Makes me wonder how is that kitchen.<br>Please do something about it.

I was in town on business and decided to eat here since it was close to my hotel, what a mistake. I like their food and was immediately disappointed by the cleanliness of this restaurant. The table had food crumbs on it and even worse the silverware had food stuck to it. The manager was nice about the situation but I couldn&#39;t eat here after that.

You know what you are going to get when you go to the Cheesecake Factory.  Its consistent, reliable and darn that honey wheat bread is addicting, probably more so than any cheesecake they have.  <br><br>I have been pretty much coming here since it opened, and there has been periods of time where I stopped coming.  Not really sure why, maybe it was the new options in the area, but on our visit last night, I had a pretty good time.  It was late at night, but still packed for a Monday night.  We were a party of two, and usually we don&#39;t waste our time waiting in line, we just go straight to the bar for self-seating area.  There were tables available but we chose to sit at the actual bar.  <br><br>If you ever been to Cheesecake, you know they have a rather large menu, but they also have several new add-on menus with healthier/simpler dishes and tapas/small-bite options.  I opted for the Almond-crusted Salmon salad, with a grilled-shrimp add-on, and the wifey pants got the Kale and Quinoa salad with grilled-shrimp.<br><br>The bartender assisting us was super cool.  Got us a basket of bread and took care of us the entire night.  Food took a little longer than expected, but not too long and it was prepared perfectly.  The Almond-crusted Salmon was super tasty, and the salad was ok, I actually preferred my wifey&#39;s salad.   Overall, both meals were very good and we left satisfied.<br><br>I have to say that when we left, we realized that the Cheesecake can be back on our regular rotation.  Usually we would go to Yard House, or their sister restaurant Grand Lux because of the wait times, but considering the consistency and service at the Cheesecake, its certainly a great option in Aventura.  There is major construction going on in the vicinity of this restaurant, so parking right now is very tight and hectic.  You can valet or park in one of the garages as an option.  <br><br>Solid 4 stars for food, service and consistency.  Only negative would be limited beers on draft and somewhat long wait times.  Give them a try if you are in the area.

I have been going to Cheesecake Factory many years and this location is one of the few sit down eating options at Aventura Mall. With that being said it is always packed and therefore they should plan for the crowds but they don&#39;t. <br><br>We put our name in party of 2 10 minutes believe me there is no science to this as they just give a time of 10 minutes so you won&#39;t leave. We said we will sit inside or out but either option is crowded and loud. So after 20 minutes we get called for a table for 2 inside one side bench seat the other side chair. The entire evening my husband would move his jackets that he just purchased so the 2 year old next to us could go back and forth to her seat all night. <br><br>The service was lousy as our waitress took our drink orders but came back saying it will be awhile as the bar is backed up. We order our food and various servers came to bring our appetizer and than our entrees. These are not timed but just randomly given out. Therefore you get your appetizer and once you start eating my entree comes and than by the time I am done my husband gets his entree. Also forget about getting another drink as that ain&#39;t happening. <br>So the Mojito I had was great but if I want another drink I guess I have to go somewhere else. The Tex mex rolls were good mini in size and the dips of salsa and avocado were great. The lettuce wraps too generous a portion so I got a to go box that was flinged at me quickly so I will get to eat later when I can get a drink to wash it down. After we already asked for the check and got it from our server she thought it would be a great time after the fact to ask if we want dessert. Crazy I know but I needed a drink and that wasn&#39;t being offered as I guess the bar is still backed up. <br>My photos below are from my last visit as well as the current visit, but I didn&#39;t write a review interesting before the southwestern egg rolls were 8 large ones now they are 8 mini for the same price. Also luckily last time I was able to actually eat cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory. <br>Bottom line great food consistently but always terrible service at this location.

I&#39;ve come here a few times and each time is vastly different. My visit today was good but because of pervious visits, I took off a star. The butter is always cold for some reason so forget about spreading it on your bread. Service is normally good but a little slower than you&#39;d expect. issues I&#39;ve had in the past are with the salads lettuce looking old and brown and them not taking items off that I asked. I got a crispy chicken sandwich this time and it was decent. Best thing there by far is the avocado toast.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. This location, however, was not up to par with my normal experience. <br><br>A friend and I decided to eat here while visiting the area. We were seat within 5 minutes but place in a awkward crowed table. This gave us little privacy and ruined the experience a little. <br><br>The food was ok. It wasn&#39;t the best I&#39;ve had from a Cheesecake Factory, but it wasn&#39;t horrible. <br><br>Our waiter was very friendly and is the main reason I&#39;m giving this location 3 stars. He was very helpful.<br>I&#39;m hoping this whole experience was just the outcome of a busy dinner rush. <br><br>I would try this location again, just not on a busy day.

Awful  experience. We ordered appetizers, it never made it to the table until we reminded the waiter. He however was extremely sincere with his apology. The food took about 45 minutes. While eating a New York strip steak, a piece of black plastic was in my food. We asked for a manger to show and explain the concern and he didn&#39;t seem to be concerned whatsoever. His first response was that it was from the bottom of the pan from normal use and never even said sorry or took any ownership. We didn&#39;t want it for free, or anything compensated, just simple ownership. The manager admitting it was from the pan made it worse! Does that mean we are multiple pieces of plastic?! Disappointed.

I had a $50 gift certificate so I went there. Two salads and 2 alcohol free drinks later the total bill was $70. You can&#39;t go charging  12.50 for drinks with no alcohol. Heck, I can go to Flanagan&#39;s and get the best Long Island tea on the planet for 7.00 or less. And their food is awesome. It&#39;s just that we had a gift card to cheesecake.<br>My net pay was $20, and it was barely worth that.<br>Place is very average with high prices. Not going back in the near future.

I went to cheesecake factory in Aventura for my mother&#39;s birthday I got there and the front desk told me was 5 minutes waiting then she called me back and said she made a mistake it should be 15-20 min i said fine. Then they said was a table inside the bar so I could seat there. My family and I set on the table it took 5-10 minutes to get the bread and water. Then we ordered appetize and dinner. While we were eating the waitress keep coming to the table to ask if we were finished. I believe she was rushing us to finish. At one point I realized she had took my french fries and I even had finish it. After she tried to take my plate and I told her I was still eating my sandwich then tried to take my father&#39;s plate also and he was still eating. Between all that I had ask the front desk to sing happy bday to my mom. She said yes just tell the waitress which i don&#39;t know how I am able to talk to my waitress without my mothers see it. Anyways we finished the dinner I ask the waitress for dessert and sing happy birthday so she came with the cheesecake but there was no happy bday sing when they had just sing to the table next to us. I decided not to give any tip for this horrible service and when I saw my bank statement I realized that they add $10 I believe on tips. The original bill was $115.76 so I had split with my sister $57 each and some change and I was charged $67.76. So yes becareful always check yours bank statement.

Mark the day 1/11/2019 12:20 pm. A party of two for lunch. With more than half the place empty, we were sat a table tightly fit in between other crowed tables. We decided to move to one of three empty booths in the section that was being populated with clients and were asked to go back to our table or the reception desk where we were informed there were no booths available. All in a very bad tempered manner!!! What a pity, it has been of my favorite places for over 17 years.

Hostess was rude and NOT polite!  She said they called our name but we were right outside and never heard them!  She was rude and blamed someone else that Called our name?! <br>We walked out because the place smelled like toilets were backed up?!<br><br>Worse Cheesecake Factory ever

I love cheesecake and their food, but I came earlier today for dinner and I am with my child. she is 10 and the waiter taking our order said that my child couldn&#39;t order off the kids menu because she isnt 10 and under. now they&#39;re just assuming people&#39;s ages that&#39;s not right. how do they know my child isn&#39;t 10? this is not how you treat your costumers and i will not be coming back  any time soon. On top of that i found a hair in my food. this is the most disrespectful service i&#39;ve ever had at any restaurant. not nice

This is the worst dining experience I&#39;ve ever had. They &#34;accidentally&#34; sat the wrong group at our reserved table, we waited 90 minutes for our food (after waiting 45 minutes to be sat), the food arrived cold and dry, and to top it all off, the manager Devin was incredibly rude. Never wasting my money on Cheesecake Factory ever again.

This place is ALWAYS packed it&#39;s crazy and overwhelming but the food has always been good.  If you don&#39;t want to wait in line go to the bar there seems to always be seats open.  They should put some sort of partition up where the servers come pick up drinks as the majority of them were loud, joking, talking about their coworkers, even saw two coworkers kiss each other, that was a first. <br><br>Michael the bartender on the other hand is a superstar and a clear stand out from the rest of the staff from all my visits.  He was Attentive, kind, quick and funny. His boss should be extremely proud to have him on the team. Whatever you do don&#39;t let that man go.
We ordered the Celebration Cheesecake for my son&#39;s birthday. It was amazing! It consists of cheesecake and vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate mousse.
