This is normally my favorite restaurant but this time changed my mind I asked if they could do a birthday thing and they never did it the silverware was all on top of the table nothing under neath it not wrapped or anything and when we asked for some that hasn&#39;t been sitting on the table the guy had a whole attitude the food wasn&#39;t that good the pasta I normally get tasted like they dumped a whole pound of sugar in it and it wasn&#39;t spicy at all I got the spicy chipotle chicken pasta and I didn&#39;t even get my favorite part Desert bc my food was not good at all

I drove all the way from south beach just to try the red velvet cheesecake, once i got it it tasted old and dry i was unable to finish it. The server was rude and very un attentive. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this location

I had THE WORST dining experience at Cheesecake Aventura yesterday! This is a place I&#39;ve been to many many times before, and on this occasion I went with a friend/client for a drink and dessert while we talked. We decided to grab a table in the bar area because it was first come first serve. The waitress showed up, didn&#39;t introduce herself but she didn&#39;t seem rude, and took our drink order. She returned about 10 minutes later with our drinks. After an HOUR of sitting there, we hadn&#39;t even gotten so much as a glance to check on us and our drinks or if we wanted to order but she was constantly checking in the tables next to us. We were so patient and tried waiving her down multiple times. After dessert we were counting 2 hours + and had seen the table next to us change twice. At that point we were basically begging for our check. We asked for the manager to explain our frustrations in the hopes of getting an apology, but he literally came in with THE worst attitude and no apology at all. I am not one to complain easily because I&#39;ve worked in the industry but I could not believe how ridiculous the service was!  I&#39;m super disappointed in you guys and embarrassed that it happened while with a client. Get it together!

My husband took me here today for an early birthday movie and lunch celebration. I enjoy this place and their menu options. Today was the first day I really did not enjoy our experience. I ordered a app. Size Caesar salad with grilled salmon without croutons and my husband ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken breast with broccoli. The waitress asked if he wanted the lunch  portion and clearly he said no the full size as he could only eat the chicken and veggies no carbs. So our food arrived with his being the lunch portion , and my salad having croutons. The waitress didn&#39;t even say anything about my croutons so I just removed them . <br><br>I was eating the salmon and did not notice at first it was medium rare. First, I never knew I had to tell my waitress what I would like. The salmon looked fully cooked on the edges until I cut it in half. I asked the waitress and she told me I need to tell my waiter or waitress how I like it cooked. I looked at her like you are our waitress. I never knew that and told her I wish she would have mentioned that to me because each restaurant has a different way of making food. She said yeah and just ignored the whole response. She is lucky I am not pregnant because if I was I would lose it. You don&#39;t as me how i would like my salmon cooked and you pick for me medium -rare. Wow , just wow. Her name was Sarai. My husband meal took forever to correct that he just had it to go . She never once talked to the manager to notify him of the issues not apologize for the mistakes. <br><br>It is sad when a good company has certain people that make it look bad. I had some really amazing waiters and waitresses here that work there butt off and if there is an issue they try to resolve it. They know how to be efficient and provide great customer service . So she does not reflect her co workers that are actually good. I just won&#39;t want her to be my server ever again. Also, if it is true what she said about the Salmon the company needs to put that on the menu. Undercooked fish is dangerous and can make someone sick. If what she says is false I hope the manager will address this.

This Cheesecake Factory is very busy due to its location but still pretty good. For an appetizer I got the crispy crab bites which are delicious. Then I got the Asian salad lunch portion which was a good size considering it&#39;s lunch.

Everything was significant I only give this four stars because they took out my favorite plate; the spring rolls. I ordered the chicken sandwich with buffalo sauce and it was marvelous. <br><br>        I also tried some of my friends shrimp tacos and they were good. It needed more sauce so I tried it with Tabasco and it was better. If you eat at &#34;CHEESECAKE FACTORY&#34;, you must save room for the cheese cake. I tried it and it was wonderful. I highly recommend this place to you all.

Pro: food is good<br><br>Cons: where do I start!<br>After being seated, we waited at least 30 mins before the waiter came to take our orders. Didn&#39;t bring bread or water during that wait. He disappeared after he took our orders and took about another 40 mins to get our food. No one checked in to see if we were okay until a manager came by to check on us. The waiter took forever to bring the drinks and food. He didn&#39;t even bring us a refill on something as simple as water. We bought a whole cheesecake to go at the end of our dinner and when we asked for a bag to carry the cake he made it seem like we were bothering him for more help. Service sucks. And if you sit outside there&#39;s a weird stench from a fountain.

Solid four stars. My fiancé was turned off from ordering a burger at Cheesecake many years ago, and I urged him to try this restaurant chain again.<br><br>We found out at the busy hostess circle that we&#39;d be seated in 10 mins it seemed shorter than that to me. <br>This Aventura Mall location seems busy every time Im here. You will also hear almost every language but English customers in the restaurant.<br>We come before going to a movie at the AMC in the Mall.<br><br>The service is always great. We had waters and they kept them filled. <br><br>I ordered the Caprese mozarella pizza it was thin crust, great cheese and flavor. I gave my man a bite and he said it reminded him of the pizza from Italy. I recommend the pizza.<br><br>The Smokehouse BBQ burger made with onion rings, bacon and cheese.  The burger was well crafted and the side of fries come in a wax paper cone in a metal spiral holder, so not that many fries come with the burger -he didnt complain. It was a great burger.<br><br>We came back and ordered dishes for dinner that were great.<br><br>Got a Slice of the Linda&#39;s layered chocolate cake to go.. I must say as a chocolate lover I compare every piece of cake to it, and none make the cut.  Cheesecake Factory really makes outstanding desserts. The layers of chocolate icing and moist chocolate cake and topped off with chocolate chips up the side and served with whip cream. I really love this cake!<br><br>Another fav is Godiva chocolate cheese cake as a chocolate lover I even had ordered one for my birthday one year!<br><br>My man is a red velvet cake fan. Some places don&#39;t come close to red velvet, Cheesecake Factory knows what&#39;s up in desserts.<br><br>Great place for good service and good food and atmosphere.
Jamaican black pepper chicken ! Epic.<br>Cant wait to come back!

I don&#39;t know where to start, if anyone knows me well, they know the Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant; But for the past few months every single time I visit the Cheesecake Factory, I don&#39;t get my food until an hour later. For the most part the managers do apologize and try to accommodate you; but I don&#39;t want a discount or free food, I just want my damn food on time. This was my favorite restaurant for the past 10 years, but now I&#39;m forced to find somewhere else.

My family and I went for dinner last week! I am so upset we sat for 2 hours waiting for food! Our sever was so rude! And when we tipped her only 10% she had the nerve to follow us outside and ask why! She never apologized for the bad service. The whole experience was horrible I&#39;ll never be back to that location!

I typically shy away from eating at these chains when we travel, but it was a good experience. Service is really good, and have a great patio. 3 of us had the grilled salmon salad which was actually quite good as was the chicken parm dish my father in law had

I hate shopping, and I hate malls; however, we had an errand to run in the area, and Larry S. knows the only way to get me to submit to a retail experience is to liquor me up, so we stopped here for happy hour. <br><br>The happy hour deal is great; a wide variety of drinks for less than $6. Since we had recently eaten at Steak &#39;n Shake (ugh!), we didn&#39;t partake of the similarly priced HH bites, but they looked great. Larry had a Long Island Iced Tea (x2) and I had a pink lemonade and a mojito. The bartender was friendly and if I were not an honest person, we would have gotten 4 drinks for the price of 1 as she didn&#39;t tote up the bill correctly.<br><br>I would stop off here first for happy hour next time I had to subject myself to the torture of mall shopping.

Whether you&#39;re coming in for a full hearty meal or just a slice of cheesecake, it&#39;s hard to go wrong with The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>One of my favorite dishes is the sweet corn tamales. Not many people know about this dish (and it is on the happy hour menu so you can try it for the cheap), and it&#39;ll change your life! It&#39;s such a perfect mix of the sweet corn outside with the lightly spicy goodness that they fill the tamale with. <br><br>My other go to dish is the hibachi steak. Such a big portion that I normally am able to share the dish with someone else and like Magic.... one meal becomes two. Their portions are huge!<br><br>Cheesecake must: red velvet cheesecake or their anniversary one that&#39;s chocolate cake with cheesecake all in one. You&#39;re welcome!!

This the restaurant where you can take anyone to and there will be something on the menu they will enjoy. I have been going to this restaurant for 18 years now, and it is consistent with food and presentation. Love the vibe, the lemonade and the cheesecakes of course! When you don&#39;t feel like eating in, you can order and pick up or order through an online delivery service ex: doordash and they can bring it to you if you live in the Aventura area. If they could bring back their potato soup that would definitely make my heart happy

Last Sunday April 7, 2019 my wife and I went to Cheesecake Factory in Aventura Mall for their legendary guacamole and angel hair shrimp. We registered for a party of two and waited to have our names called to be seated. We were given a small table for two but when we requested to be seated in a bigger table already set we were sent back to the receptionist and we were told by the receptionist that we had to wait ten more minutes to be accommodated for a bigger table like the ones we wanted because those were already reserved. It was organized in a first come first serve basis and it was our turn. <br>What happened to hospitality manners?<br>Is it a corporate guideline of Cheesecake Factory to seat customers wherever the receptionist chooses &#34;or else&#34; or was it just pure and simple poor customer service?<br>Was it because it was counterproductive for Cheesecake Factory seat two people in a table of four even though it was our turn leaving us, the customers, with a limited choice &#34;or else&#34; one had to wait ten more minutes which could be extended as punishment for not having accepted the option g<br>Finally we found a table at the bar and enjoyed the food in spite of the incident.

Soo..we got in pretty fast for a sat at 530<br>Bathroom: smelled like pee!<br>Ordered ice tea...had to remind server 3 times for sugar<br>Food was good..it&#39;s cheesecake factory they are usually consistent..<br>Utensils on table were dirty<br>Bread plates had food stuck to them

Ok, let&#39;s be honest....raise your hand if you&#39;re using the gift card your mother in law gave you 2 years ago..... ::raises hand::<br><br>I like Cheesecake Factory. All of the ones I have been to push out a quality meal with exceptional service. We went on a Sunday around 4pm and waited about 30 minutes for a table. Food came out pretty quick considering that the restaurant was at full capacity. The Cuban rolls are always a must! Try them if you haven&#39;t already!<br><br>My one complaint is that the floors were EXTREMELY slippery! Seriously, it felt like there was butter everywhere. Even in my Nikes, I almost fell twice walking to the table. I really don&#39;t know how anyone else did not fall.
We always go for our favorite dish - Sweet corn tamale cakes. They have the perfect combination of a sweet sour taste. The place is constantly busy but service is excellent.

I recently visited Miami and this location in the mall.  The service started out great with a very attentive waiter who helped with our menu selections. Appetizers arrived hot and fast.  There after it was terrible service!!! The waiter did not give us any update on our food order nor tell us what was taking so long.  We then asked to speak to the manager who try to compensate our time by offer us free dessert.  Once we denied that selection he only wanted to compensate us for the appetizers only.  With still NO DAMN FOOD!!! We did not receive an explanation nor any sympathy for our time.  We left without any explanations and will never return again to this location.

Myself and my family will never come here again. Quoted a 30min wait, ended up waiting double that. When finally sat, the five of us were brought to a table that normally seats four. As being sat we saw a large booth clean and available. We asked the host to sit there, she checked with the desk and came back to say &#34;no, sorry this table is for parties of 6&#34;... Less than five minutes later, a different party of five was sat at this table. Thus lied to for the first time. Shortly after receiving our drinks, another large booth opened up. I went to the front to ask if we could move to this table, explaining that three family members are visiting from Europe and leaving tomorrow and we would greatly appreciate a more private experience. The manager then said &#34;I&#39;m sorry this is for a party of 6 or more&#34;... About 10 minutes later ANOTHER PARTY OF 5 sat there. Thus lied to the second time. <br><br>It is obvious this establishment only cares about getting people in and out, and could give two f**** about actually making their customers happy. A simple move could have enhanced and changed my families last night together. Instead I was so frustrated I could not even enjoy my food. <br><br>The knives had nasty slim on them from not being polished. One appetizer came out 10 minutes before the second. Worst restaurant experience I&#39;ve had in a long time. Never again will come back.

People, its a Cheese cake factory. No idea what some people are expecting. It is big as their Corporation. When I come here I know what to expect and what type of food I am getting. I love it. For me the most important thing is SERVICE and they have very nice people working there. William who took us to our table was amazing. What a nice and handsome guy. He spoke Spanish to my grandmother who immediately fell in love with him. Good job. <br>We loved our food especially the Red Velvet cheesecake O M G ...it was extremely good. <br> I think our waiter&#39;s name was Juan.. very nice as well. <br>We are locals so we always come here. I hope I get to see Williams smile again. Nice employees means good managment. Bravo.

There is so much hype that surrounds this chain and the crowds are always vast. I wonder if it truly is the namesake, or the allure of the overdone dining hall, or just the options for days on the menu. Anyway you slice it, Cheesecake works for a lot and the food is more than adequate.<br><br>This location in Aventura mall of course is always packed. I went this past weekend with my folks, so it was three of us, and the wait around 6PM was about 35 minutes. Not too bad after we surveyed the amount of people I must say. But with a huge outdoor area and vast dining room, that amount of people still needed a substantial wait. No big deal.<br><br>Once we sat, we were promptly greeted by a nice server who gave us bread right away, always a plus, and brought our drinks quickly. After we ordered, the food came rather quick with all things considered.<br><br>I am happy to report, and also have posted a photo for, the newly added &#34;Falafel Salad. I realized after I ordered that I had made it vegan, which works for me even though I am not. I just opted for no feta cheese nor dressing, and added some olive oil. This made for a wonderful salad filled with Kale, Romaine, Tomatoes, Cucumber and of course, Falafel. A great taste and would be a recommedndation from me for others.<br><br>We of course concluded the meal wiht the perfect slice of fresh strawberry cheesecake and split three ways, none of us felt bad about the adition I am sure. Ha. All in all, it was a great experience, I give the place three stars as it is just another chain that you can enjoy in Miami or across the country; nothing special.

I&#39;ve been eating the Cheesecake Factory for about 17 years now and I have never ordered something I didn&#39;t like, literally everything is good it&#39;s a must and you can&#39;t compare there prices are fare especially for the amount of food you get, you can share with someone leave room for some coffee and cheesecake

The gumbo is my favorite thing on the menu. Happy hour is also great too! Love Cheesecake factory.  When I arrived it was very busy sat in the bar area. Our server CJ was very kind and attentive. Listened well and didn&#39;t make us feel rush even though they were very busy.

Just uhmazinggggg. The tex mex eggrolls (with lotsss of lime) are the bomb diggity. We tried the white chicken chili.... wow that was great too. It looked smaller than most entrees but was still full afterwards.

I had a great experience here. We were seated right away. We had a really awesome server who had a great understanding of the menu. She was super friendly and made conversation (but not too much lol). She helped me make my own concoction of my food. <br><br>I had been to another Cheesecake Factory previously and remembered having some kind of pasta with pink sauce. I described the dish to her, and she said that they don&#39;t really have an item on the menu that has &#34;pink sauce&#34;. She recommended something that a lot of other people have ordered, which is a combination sauce made out of alfredo sauce and marinara sauce. This was a perfect mixture and fulfilled my craving for what I was wanting. She made sure that I was happy with the food that she helped me create. The lemon drop drink was very good. The bread was good as always. The mac and cheese balls appetizer is also always delicious.

So this is your typical Cheesecake Factory except they could care less if your meal comes out wrong, takes longer than usual, if they add items you didn&#39;t order to the bill, or not deliver your food at all.  Could just be that we had the worst waiter in America but I doubt it.  Save your money and go next door there&#39;s an awesome boutique Italian restaurant. 6/18/17.<br><br>I did view the comment below from management and sent them further details at the &#39;contact us&#39; area of their website on 6/21/17.  I will update review after hearing back from them.  As of today 7/2/17 no one from Cheesecake Factory replied so I guess they just post a comment about being concerned whenever they get a negative review but never actually address it.  Not going to this location again.

I love it. But do have wait awhile because a lot of peoples go there. Must be that good. Picture see is egg roll samples. Taste good. Favorite the one with avocado one. Had order spicy chicken sandwich. Not shown in picture. It really good. Make no mess. Feel light on my hands. Juicy. Hmm. My boyfriend had salmon dinner with potatoes. His real good too. Not shown in picture. Only thing is, have to wait awhile. It worth the wait. But it isn&#39;t that long though. Top of that it in Aventura mall.

Cheesecake factory. What can I say, its the same as any other. Consistent, great cheese cake, variety of types, with red velvet being my personal favorite. Service standards are pretty good. The wait time here was pretty long for a Thursday at 2 but its Miami and a pretty nice mall. Worth a visit but be prepared for a wait.

We shopped and then decided to eat before going back to our hotel. We put our name down for 4. When the guy called our name we approached the counter he then took a table of 2 ahead of us so we waited. The hostess told us to follow him, I said he just took 2 people. We continued to wait. When he returned he look at us puzzled. I said we are the 4 top party u called. He said I just sat that party. I said u sat a party of 2. U called our name party of 4. We walked out. I returned a few minutes later to speak with the manager. He informed me he was the manager. I told him that was unprofessional and we were not happy and left.  I actually give them a 0 star!!!

Visited on the night of 11/16. <br>Giving 2 stars for very low quality meat. Do not go there for steaks or plates with beef of any kind. <br><br>After I tried to cutting through the New York stake I ordered with a steak knife, I found that it tasted like rubber. <br><br>When I complained to the manager that my steak wasnt edible, he talked to me like to someone who tried to get a free plate... I did ask him to take the steak off my bill. The conversation was very unpleasant, the manager didnt care about customer service whatsoever! Simply coming to the table isnt customer service!

Nov 13. Nice ambiance, nice place to eat. I had better luck in the past.  Today I decided to order Fish and Chips, what a let down.  The fish was so greasy I had to ask for paper napkins to absorb some oil before eating.  Please stay away from fish and chips.   There are plenty of other better choices.

Had the vegetable salad and Kobe burger. Both very enjoyable. <br><br>Service was great, even though it was after 10pm. <br><br>Tried the Oreo cheesecake ... Great pallet cleanser to end the meal. <br><br>The waiter took 25 minutes to bring change to my bill.

Always enjoy the atmosphere and food!<br><br>What&#39;s not to like about a place that has so many varieties of cheesecake.<br><br>The brown oat bread is amazing!<br><br>Also, you should definitely try the sliders! Very tasty bun with just the right amount of burger.<br><br>Service at the bar is always fast and friendly!

Disappointed...quality of the food and size of the dishes has suffered. <br>Gumbo, tiny rubbery shimps is a river of watery salty sauce around a tower of sticky smuchy and flavorless rice.<br>The black bread was awesome :)

I liked the food we ordered a delicious Thai chicken plate and a Farfalle plate with chicken, roasted garlic and panceta that was fenomenal for dessert we had a Godaiva cheesecake but my daughter  didn&#39;t like it beacause she said the chocolate was too dark, I did like it though, so that&#39;s why I put 4 stars. I&#39;d recommend you to try the Godaiva cheesecake if you like dark chocolate.

10 years ago this place was the biggest scene. If you didn&#39;t have your name in line.... were you even visiting Florida? Today, its okay, not much has changed off the menu, the service is mediocre and the food doesn&#39;t always live up to the description (hence my spicy chicken tacos were not spicy at all) <br><br>A little disappointed by the service. I got here at 1130. It was literally empty, yet my food and drinks took longer to come out than those who arrived and we seated 30 minutes after me. <br><br>I wish this place was still as great as it was 10 years ago, we used to wait hours for a table, now it&#39;s not even worth it... even if you&#39;re the only one here!

I used to really like going here to grab a bite and drink, but the last 3 times i have gone, the service is not up to par but the food is mostly consistent with how it&#39;s always been. I usually sit in the bar area and the service is slow- like i&#39;ve had to wait more than 5 minutes for the check. I hope management reads the reviews and tries to improve service.

The strongest happy hour in the mall. Also the most bang for your buck. <br><br>Either come with friends and split several appetizers weighing in at $5.50 or crush their skinny cocktails that don&#39;t skip on the bite and cost the same. I prefer a little of both. Bartenders close to excellent on mixing their various combinations of moonstone and long islands. <br><br>I appreciate the bread regardless of solo dining or not. I&#39;ve been here 30+ times now and can only remember two times when I&#39;ve felt a little bothered by their service. Their items on the happy hour menu are still big for the costs and I find myself taking some home often. All in all you can get a little buzz and food in you for under $20 which is always good feeling.<br><br>Regular hours are pretty good too, but this is strictly a Bar review in my eyes.
Kids luv the cheesecake, and it&#39;s so not easy to get to eat inside. Anyway, the foods are yummy and the service is OK.

So far before we sat down the hostess was rude and did not look up from whatever she was doing to address us. The seating was relatively quick. The waitress was slow, totally ignored us, unless we literally had to look for her. She brought us what is us cold and hard bread which is usually hot and fresh. She began to walk away without taking our order<br> Smh. Plus we had to get another hostess to get someone else to take our order. When we finally ordered andreceived it she handed me the hot plate and ran off.<br><br>Never again will we waste or time and money at this location. This is the first cheesecake factory we have ever had such horrible service. We always find one when we are out of town but not this one ever again.  The two stars are for the food only.

Decided to come here with the gf simply because of the fact that we had a gift card to use up. There are so many great places to go out and eat, particularly in this area, so this definitely wouldn&#39;t be my first choice... ever. This trip reassured that sentiment. The service was terrible. The food came out one dish at a time which is normal but not when it&#39;s more than a 15 minute time difference. And the food was merely OK. I ordered a burger that had bacon and I can&#39;t recall what else and not only was it on the saltier side but the fries it was accompanied with didn&#39;t taste fresh. Now, you may wonder why I didn&#39;t simply let the waitress know... well for starters I would have had she came around and checked up on us and then there&#39;s the fact that the kitchen was probably backed up so who knows in what year I would&#39;ve gotten my replacement dish. As I mentioned at the beginning, there are so many great places to eat. Why would this be an option?

Horrible Horrendous Service!  Does not deserve 1 star!  Got seated and fake server Carina M. was nice and fake at first until a larger party was seated next to us. Then she forgot all about me and my guest and we sat and sat and sat with no drinks and no nothing.  Finally had to drag down another server to ask for manager!  Manager Brian Vasquez was a worthless robot who only lied and lied and kept making excuses for her bad behavior and did not offer a resolution or help us at all!  He lied and would not give me our server&#39;s name so I could call about her inept and u professional behavior.   Of course it was on the receipt but his brain didnt think of that Im assuming.  Please do yourself a favor and skip this restaurant altogether!!   The service is disgusting and the wait times as well as the atmosphere and attitudes are not worth your time and money.   You will not be treated like a human being but like cattle <br><br>Update:   Contacted Customer Service and they are a joke and very unprofessional!   I tried explaining what happened and they were very rude and condescending and nasty as well.  I have now contacted the BBB Better Business Bureau and filed a complaint and they are doing an investigation on this matter and place of so called business!<br><br>Update:   Notice how I have no Guest Services reaching out to me under my post line everyone else.  Coincidence?   I don&#39;t think so.   Shady business practices and unprofessional.   <br><br>Update:  Guest Services only posted under mine after I pointed this out.  Disgusting restaurant and busi practices. Now more people are exposing this dishonest and disgusting business!

This place is a joke. I love their cheesecakes but only to take out and that&#39;s it. We try to have a lunch and half of the restaurant was empty but Hostesses who are by the way so arrogant and rude told us there&#39;s a 30 minutes wait, when we asked why she responded that they don&#39;t have waiters to serve us jajajaja. Of course we went to eat somewhere else. Never coming back here again except to buy cheesecake to go.

Basic Mood: Busy yet Calm<br><br>Basics on the Crew: Jason is ACE! He will remember you &amp; your orders per visit! <br><br>Basically Saying: Skip sitting at a table &amp; join the bar crew! This is where the fun lies, food comes quicker, &amp; the team have great rapports with their guests! <br><br>Basic Enough to go?: Dig in! <br><br>Basic Options: Kale/Quinoa Salad (The Grapes Are An Amazing Touch), Fried Mac &amp; Cheese (Save Space in Your Gut), Pink Lemonade (We experimented Jason tried variations!!!)

Cheesecake Factory is always a good idea. With such an extensive menu there is something for everyone. This location is in Aventura mall and it&#39;s always our first choice when we want to take a break from shopping to enjoy some delicious food. Today we were lucky enough to be seated as soon as we got there but usually there is a wait. Our waitress, Michelle was amazing. She was thoughtful and attentive, going the extra mile to make us feel welcomed. We had warm bread and drinks within moments of sitting down and she brought extra dipping sauces without us even having to ask. When we were finished eating she saw here was food leftover and asked if we wanted her to pack it up. When I told her I was planning on taking it to my boyfriend she added utensils, extra warm bread, and separated each item in its own container. She was truly exceptional. The food was great as always. We ordered the Avocado egg rolls and they were fresh and tasty. We shared the Chicken Littles platter between two of us and there was still leftover to take. The portions are huge and definitely shareable. If you haven&#39;t tried this place you should.

Second time I&#39;ve visited within a month.  The first time it was horrible but I was with a large party so I excused the food because of the crowd.  However, today I ordered take out.  The Jamaican Black pepper shrimp was horrible.  The rice was hard and the black beans and shrimp had an odor.  I think the entire meal was made from old ingredients.  I also had the cheeseburger egg rolls that did not resemble the picture at all . . . It was more like what you&#39;d purchase at the supermarket.  Lastly, I had the crab bites that were fried so hard they were like rocks.  Seeing this is was take out, I did not return to the restaurant, I just threw it away.  I am done with Cheesecake Factory.  It used to be quality food, but now it&#39;s disgusting.

Plates were dirty. Flatware old and  bent out of shape. Menus had food stuck in them. Service was sub par on a weekday lunch hour with a medium crowd and plenty of wait staff present. Food was good but I Wouldn&#39;t recommend this location.

service is slow. way too overrated. i should&#39;ve done this review a long time ago. food is terrible, like how can you possibly fail at making Alfredo pasta?? i can make it better at home with my store bought jars. best thing here is the cheesecake and fried mac n cheese (only reason i gave 2 stars)<br><br>*vegans and vegetarians, veggie burger sucks. worst i&#39;ve ever tried*

Very bad customer experience. We are frequent customers of this and other locations. We asked for a table for 5, we waited 40 minutes at the bar and after that, they gave us a small 4 places table. One of us was a pregnant woman sitting on the alley. When I ask for a bigger table the manger with very bad manners told us we will have to wait 15 more minutes... but the worst was how rude he was to us, making fun at my husband. No one said sorry or apologize. Won&#39;t come back.
Roast beef was nastily over salted, burgers not very good, Mac and cheese was gross, super busy, ok wait staff, food was not good

The good: Food is terrific; best Eggs Benedict I&#39;ve ever had!  Drinks are great.  Service is great, nice people, just a bit busy.  Come here if you have time.  It is a popular place and food can take a bit longer than usual, but the experience is well worth it.  <br>The opportunity: utensils and dishes could be bit cleaner.  Hence my 4 stars instead of 5. In sum: this is a very consistent place when you want to have a great meal with time to enjoy the experience. Updating review as management took action on feedback.

Dined in tonight with a party of 6 to celebrate my mother in laws birthday. The asada steak medallions and the Louisiana chicken pasta are wonderful and full of flavor. Besides the great food and drinks, this review is mainly for the server we had named Kevin. Who first of all is a ball of fun and made her birthday dinner perfect. He was very engaging and super knowledgeable  about the menu. Giving great suggestions and just really having fun with us and made us feel like family. He created a genuine personal experience that&#39;s hard to come by in the restaurant business nowadays. My mother in law is still talking about Kevin and how she can&#39;t wait to come back and ask for him. Thank you, Kevin for being an awesome server and person don&#39;t ever change! See you soon!

Worst customer service ever! We asked for a birthday party for 16 people and they split our tables with no option to be sat next to each other, the manager refuse to any option we proposed and the host was the most sour person when take us to the table. First and last time in this place. Definitely I wouldn&#39;t recommend this place to anybody.

We are here on a Sunday evening. The food was good. We ate in the bar which was very noisy, due to the televisions and music blasting at the same time. At 8:00pm the lights dimmed to the point where I couldn&#39;t see my food. When I asked if they could please turn the lights back the way it was before 8:00, the waiter gave me a bullshit excuse that the lights were on timers and couldn&#39;t be changed. Also, the men&#39;s room was so disgusting! The waiter gave us a real rush job, but in all fairness, the place was busy.

Have been coming to the cheesecake for years now, but today&#39;s experience was by far the best ..... truly exceptional service by Alejandro Chapelin, Checked constantly to see how service was and went above and beyond the call of duty! A tremendous asset to the cheesecake factory !!!

Received the worst customer service I&#39;ve received in a Cheesecake Factory on my first time trying this location. <br><br>My first server took 10 mins to greet me, never looked at our table again after taking our initial order (no water refill, nothing, all food and drink was brought by others). This was especially annoying because he asked the table next to us how they were.<br><br>Then, when our main course was halfway done (brought out by a food runner) someone else asked if we were ok. I asked who she was and she said she&#39;s our server. I asked who the first server was and she said there was a mixup. Interesting. Maybe this is why we were ignored our entire meal?<br><br>Took the manager aside and told her in detail my negative experience and she said sorry and that she will have to follow up with my server. She then asked if I will be paying in cash or credit. When I handed her my credit card, she charged me my full bill and didn&#39;t so much as offer me a cheesecake. I received awful customer service, was ignored, no refills, neither server introduced themselves with their name---but I was still expected to pay in full and without any sort of accommodation for the terrible service.

Very bad customer service . Awful attitude. Manager very unprofessional . Cheese Cake decreased their service soooooo bad from years ago . It&#39;s a shame. I used to love to come here. Pembroke Gardens so far the best .<br>Aventura Mall horrible.
sercive was ok. the food was could been better the gumbo pasta one was ok .
Had the chopped salad with chicken, it was fresh and tasty. Service was excellent. Beer was warm

I was disappointed today with my Door Dash order from this restaurant which i usually enjoy. I ordered a meatloaf dinner and requested extra gravy which i did not get. Also, i have enjoyed this meal at least 3 times over the past few years, usually sharing the large portion. Today, it was really spicy for me. I couldn&#39;t eat it. I also ordered a kids meal of chicken sliders with a side of fresh fruit,  and a kids meal of alfredo with a side of fresh fruit.  We only received 1 side of fresh fruit.  The alfredo was tasty, and cooked aldente, as i think it should be.  I also ordered a slice of oreo cheesecake,  delicious, enough to share.  Unfortunately,  the drinks that come with the kids meals spilled in the driver&#39;s car. The driver was not given a cup holder for 2 drinks, they were put in a bag. I was not surprised they spilled and felt bad for the driver.  The cost of this door dash delivery was almost $60 including a 20% tip.

I loved this place great food and desserts are amazing. The only issue is that they have to be more organized with the reservations and the walk in due to i was there for a while even i had reservation in advance.

Been there many times. Two words: Tasty &amp; Filling. No need to say more. I&#39;ll say a little bit more. I love their skinny menu, their lettuce wrap tacos (sounds wrong) are delicious. The bread is also delicious. Reasonable prices. I go there often with a &#34;special needs&#34; group and we&#39;ve never felt marginalized in any way by the staff nor management. It&#39;s usually crowded too. 11am people are waiting by the door for them to open that should say something about the establishment. Will keep going back.

I have not gone to the location a lot to sit down and eat but take out has been great thus far. I live a few miles from the restaurant and it seems the food is always consisent/ hot when it arrives home.

This place is awful. Rude front of house. Left us waiting and when we checked to see how much longer they added us to the bottoms of the list without care!!  Heard from friends if you are having dinner before a movie you will miss you movie!!!   Won&#39;t return.  Do not recommend.

I come here a lot -- not by choice. My family loves this place for Sunday brunch. Despite my aversion to chains, this particular location is pretty awesome. Service has always been friendly, and portions are -- as expected -- huge AF. I&#39;ve probably been here like 1000 times with my aunt/cousins/mom/family member, and it&#39;s consistent. Nothing out of this world but good; you can&#39;t really ask for more than that from a place like this.

I&#39;m ALL about The Cheesecake Factory, but this location was terrible! <br>I called to order pickup and the hostess had me on hold for a solid 5 minutes. When I finally got to someone she took my order and told me it would be about 30 minutes. <br>The parking at Aventura is horrendous but finding a spot was the easy part. We walked in to find a line out the door at the bakery/take-out counter. After waiting about 5 minutes without moving, my mom went to the register and asked where to pick the call-in orders. The lady told her &#34;you can wait her, but I&#39;ll get to you when I have time.&#34; We waited another 30 minutes to get our food and that was only after we asked the manager where it was. It had been sitting there and no one bothered to check. They then forgot the dressing for a salad and that took about another 5 minutes. <br>They didn&#39;t give us butter for the bread or any silverware. The food was ice cold and flavorless. Will literally never go to this location again, despite it being a favorite. <br>The only upside was they got the order right.

A frequent flyer here every time I visit aventura. The place is always bustling and packed. Surprisingly only had to wait 5-10min for a party of two around 5 on a Thursday. <br><br>They were out of the wonderful wheat bread which is surprisingly a first. Our waitress was very sweet but being here I kept getting the feeling that we&#39;re being rushed out of here So they can turn over tables. I ordered the ginger smash - a whiskey cocktail with ginger, simple syrup and Sprite, it was bright and refreshing. <br><br>The avocado egg rolls are the best, so simple but bright and the sweet sauce of mango and cilantro accompanying it makes the avocado, red onion wrapped in wonton. In addition split the pasta carbonara with the sigfig, it came out promptly after the egg rolls. It had more lemon than I&#39;d prefer but it was still good. We got a healthy dose of parmesan atop the pasta and feasted. <br><br> This is certainly the place you go when you want consistently good food and can&#39;t decide what to get. The menu is huge along with the portions. Highly recommend splitting an entree so you can save room for the amazing cheesecakes for dessert. My favorites are the lemon raspberry, then the coconut, and Carrot cake cheesecake. Again, portions are massive so definitely recommend splitting them.

It&#39;s not necessary to talk about the food, because all their menu is awesome!!<br>And you have to save some room for a cheesecake!! My favorite is the Redvelvet, but I discovered the Banana...simply delicious!!!!<br>The only problem I find in this location is that is always really crowded and you might freeze if you sit inside!!
I come here all the time for birthdays and holidays. The food is amazing. The service is great. But waiting is the worst. Sometimes there is no where to sit and the waiting time takes 1 hour.

Came with my two children ages 13 and 10 . It wasn&#39;t a long wait. We sat outside our server was Marina she was awesome , attentive and on point . I am pleasantly pleased and really enjoyed the Service . Thank you Marina !!!

Interesting Service, I am greeted by the front desk staff Where I request to be seated outside for a party of two. When my name was called , so were the names of five other parties. The hostess said &#34; everyone follow me!&#34; We literally walked around the outside patio like a giant Congo line (15 of us  and all different parties) squeezing between guests who are trying to eat. Hostess: ok Brian, this is tour table. Well Brian was at the rear of the cramped Congo line do we all had to wait till him and his wife squeezed through sat down and of course the rest of us watched. I had to endure watching/ experiencing 5 other parties get dat down where we were finally given a table. Wow.

Background: My husband and I were looking for a place to eat a late lunch so we decided on Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s familiar territory. I ordered the skinny licious soft chicken taco and husband ordered mushroom, spinach, bacon and cheese omelet that came with a side of potatoes and toast. Order came up to $40 for the two meals plus an iced mint green tea. <br><br>The Good:<br>- The wait time for two people on a Saturday at around 3 was less than ten minutes <br>- We were seated in an area where we had plenty of room unlike some parts of the restaurant where you are practically touching your neighbor<br>- Waiter came fairly quickly to take order <br>- The menu is in itself a book! Tons and tons of options. <br>- The bread provided was nice and warm <br>-  My husband commented that the omelet was flavourful. <br><br>The Bad:<br>- The tables around us who came after got their food much quicker than we did. It wasn&#39;t too big of a deal but we were starving!!!<br>- I asked for extra cilantro and crema on my tacos but it didn&#39;t come with it. The waiter did ask if the request was fulfilled but I was too shy to say no so I guess that was my fault. <br>- The tacos themselves were pretty bland. The chicken didn&#39;t have much flavour and it just didn&#39;t have too much flavour overall. I was very disappointed actually. I understand that it&#39;s supposed to be part of the skinny licious menu but a little more oomph wouldn&#39;t have hurt. <br><br>Summary: I think I would go back to another Cheesecake Factory but wouldn&#39;t order these tacos again. It&#39;s a great place for groups of people because there&#39;s tons of choices. As well, the cheesecakes are pretty good especially if you want to take one home to eat later.

The wait staff was very friendly and warm untill we made had a request about a burger that wasn&#39;t cooked properly. We requested that the burger be remade because it wasn&#39;t cooked properly and the waiter told us that they won&#39;t remake a fresh one they&#39;ll simply scrap the cheese off and remove any toppings and try to FIX THE SAME PATTY. I found that to be quite gross and shocking. I ordered calamari and the eggroll sampler, while the the sampler was to die for the calamari tasted old and soggy I mean completely bland no salt or pepper or anything what happened chef? As my entree I ordered the fish and chips and again it was quite boring as far as taste. Finally DESSERT! OMG! Can you say perfect, I ordered the Warm Apple Crisp it was warm and cool at the same given it has vanilla ice with baked Apple slices and cinnamon streusel goodness everywhere. I had just enough to nearly put me to sleep. This visit was supposed to be my exciting birthday dinner party and all 10 of my guest had the same comments about food. Better luck next year.
I got the lunch special including pizza and Cesar salad. The pizza was nice and cheesy however, the salad looked old and was pretty bland. The lunch special serves till 5:00pm

Service sucks!! Floor is filthy always!! No matter what time. I&#39;ve emailed before and today also it was a mess!! I had to ask for the floor to be swept!! Always the same crap! Food is delicious always but the fact that it&#39;s not clean no master what time is frustrating!!
Meh....I write &#34;meh&#34;, but I eat here often. CF has its own special character, kinda fast food-sassy-salon eating. Yeah, my &#34;meh&#34; is for mehvolous!!!!

Wow - we loved this experience. Full menu, excellent service, waitstaff attentive, and delicious tastes here. Vegan Cobb salad a standout  at $10.95. Healthy, clean, delicious and XL portion for  ingredients.  Over 2lbs easy which would have been $25 at Wholefoods for sure. <br>We will be regulars! Thank you for wowing us.

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory multiple times. However, the last time I went (yesterday), I was quite shocked to see such a mess. I don&#39;t know if they have a new manager or what IS GOING ON THERE. But I&#39;d never seen it so disorganized. I&#39;m huge in restroom cleanliness, it kind of tells you how &#34;clean&#34; the actual restaurant is. The restroom was DISGUSTING. Paper towels thrown all over the floor. In the stalls, toilet paper on the floor, PEE surrounding the toilets. Oh, and the smell..... it was sooooo bad! The handicap stall was disgusting, pee everywhere the garbage can was full of paper and there was toilet paper with poop right on top like if someone did it on purpose. The whole hour I was there I didn&#39;t see a single employee go into the bathrooms to &#34;clean&#34; it. I went to one of the girls at the front and told her about the conditions the bathrooms were in and all they said was &#34;oh, ok, we&#39;ll close the handicap stall&#34;. What about tell the customer &#34;we&#39;ll have someone take care of this right away&#34; or &#34;we&#39;ll have someone clean the bathrooms right away&#34;. No, nothing like that. All they said was they&#39;d close that one bathroom stall. I never saw them calling their manager to let him know how disgusting those restrooms were. I had to go to the mall&#39;s restrooms to have my daughter pee because I did not dare have her go near the ones in that restaurant. Can not believe the difference of the mall&#39;s restrooms cleanliness compared to the restaurants. I&#39;d think it&#39;d be the opposite. PLEASE KEEP UP WITH YOUR RESTROOMS. THEY ARE DISGUSTING AND FOR THAT ONE REASON, I WILL NOT GO BACK TO THIS RESTAURANT. My server was great, no complaints at all. But the restrooms were DISGUSTING. My server ended up taking my food back to the kitchen to warm it up because it took me a while to go to the mall with my daughter to use the restroom.
This is the best location Ive been to. Service was really good and there was barely a wait on a friday night.

Orders salmon medium rare they served it medium well after two bites I informed the server that it was not what ordered and asked to have the salmon remade . The server said yes . Few minutes later come back and told me that the manager said for health code reason they can&#39;t do it . I told the server that if I was told that I would have ordered something else . The server asked me if I wanted to finish eating and I declined . My expectations was that the salmon would be removed from the check and that the manager stop by the table to show some concern for a guests who did didn&#39;t enjoy his meal . That did not happen so I paid the bill and decided this will be my last meal at cheese cake factory .

Definitely the worst customer experience I&#39;ve had in a long time at any restaurant.  Called ahead to make sure breakfast was served.  It was confirmed yes that it was served all day. We arrived and then were told sorry that it was no longer available and that the brunch menu was only served until 2pm and that their EGG menu was served all day. This was never described over the phone.  We were there at 1:55pm and sat down at 2:05pm. When we said that it was only 2:05pm and that the only reason we came was because we were told over the phone that breakfast was served all day, we asked if they could make an exception. Our server said he would ask the manager -he came back and said that his manager said that it was fine and they would do the brunch still for me. I was elated. We put our 3 orders in and about 5 or so mins later the waiter comes back and says that he&#39;s sorry but he wasn&#39;t able to do the brunch items and that it was too late and that the same manager that approved it before is now saying no.  The manager came over to talk to our table with a &#34;what seems to be the problem&#34; attitude - you could tell he really didn&#39;t care in fact offered to tell us suggestions of other restaurants that had later brunch menus that he could send us to.  He did nothing but say &#34;sorry&#34; and didn&#39;t even try to change the experience that we were having.  Reluctantly I put in another order for their &#34;egg&#34; menu. 45 mins later we still had no food. We were given warm water with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice before the server brought us ice.  We ended up walking out hungry, thirsty and pissed off for an awful experience.  Waiter didn&#39;t care. Manager didn&#39;t care.  This establishment flat out did not care about providing a good customer experience.

I came here as often I came shop at Aventura Mall, some people may think that as being a fast restaurant food is not tasty and this is a major misunderstanding! I really appreciate eating here, there huge selection offers you a diversify that you could eat here all week and not repeat my choice. It&#39;s perfect for families with big/small kids, families reunions, big groups... It&#39;s a very casual place. I only tried to avoid vacation time and tourist season, it stays hardly full. For last the best! The original cheesecake for dessert, it&#39;s huge! Split it with you love on.

My wife and I go to cheesecake when we want to treat ourselves, good food, nice atmosphere... so we thought. when we get there, go up to the hostess and say we want to be sat outside. Then the hostess girl takes us to a table that&#39;s right next to the window on the patio, having 60% of the tables outside unoccupied. I then ask &#34;is there anyway we could sit a bit further out it just gets a bit loud, I don&#39;t mind waiting a bit more for a tables&#34; she says&#34; no we won&#39;t be having people sit on that part until 9:45pm tonight &#34; mind you it&#39;s 5 pm in the day. I thought okay I&#39;m here whatever just gonna enjoy my time. Not even two minutes go by when I see the hostess goes and sits a couple at an outside table at the far edge. I&#39;m a bit confused, so I go in and ask the hostess if sitting on the more outside part of the restaurant is still not available. &#34;No we aren&#39;t sitting that part&#34; I then ask her so why did someone just get sat in that area. Word for word her response was &#34;I don&#39;t like your attitude&#34; I&#39;m now angry, how are you going to treat a guest like that. I understand if she said she would find out or tell me she doesn&#39;t know but just straight up rude came out instead. I then went to go speak to another hostess Dasia (whom was Very helpful and professional) told us we would be moved shortly. She did mention it was her first few days working there she really tried to right the wrongs of her terrible co-worker. A manager came to speak to us, though she had some sauce on her face while talking to us, she was kind. The icing on the cake was when I ordered the impossible burger without pickles. Sure enough there were pickles. Every time  I come to cheesecake I order the same thing and specifically ask for no pickles. Pickles always end up on my burger. Sure, I usually ignore it, but after all that had happened. My wife mentions to me that her California salad tasted like the greens weren&#39;t well washed. That was the final straw. Not coming back. I advised others don&#39;t do so as well. For sure not to this location.

Wow! What amazing food this place offers. I just had the turkey sandwich with a mushroom soup. Delicious! Service is excellent and fast! Yes! Even at 2 in the afternoon at the busiest mall in Florida.

Thank you very much to our sever Josh for the great service. He took very good care of my friend and I, and made sure we were happy with our order. Truly recommend if you don&#39;t like the dull, boring servers that could care less about how your evening is going.

Let me start off with how much I enjoy coming to cheesecake factory for dinner and brunch. But this morning&#39;s experience made me think otherwise for this location. We waited about 20mins before we got our server to come by and take our drink orders. It&#39;s not busy at all so 20mins is a lot of time considering that she went to another table that sat down AFTER us first. I ordered their caramel macchiato. Walked away and didn&#39;t give me a straw. Of course I spilt it on myself for trying to drink it from the glass. Next the bread was definitely day old bread as it was hard as a rock. Only thing good about this meal was my omelette.
Love this place ! The service is great. Food is very delicious. I love coming here! The Ahi Carpaccio is yuuumm and crabcakes are pretty good too for appetizer.

Where can i start, its your typical cheesecake factory with 100 options on the menu. The food and its flavour was good and just on par with any of the other cheesecake locations i have visited. However the service was exceptional. Maybe it was because we were eating at a rather slower time that the restaurant was less busy but our waiter was great. Food came out really fast and the waiter got along great with us and made a few jokes that really did enlighten our experience.

Amazing salads and the new vegetarian burger! This is our favorite restaurant and i love this location, food comes out perfect every time. I must add to my review, we had a great server the last time we went, I believe his name is Kyshon. Very friendly

Mehhhh.....what horrible food. I ordered the herb crusted salmon, received it with absolutely no lemon butter sauce.  How the heck does that happen?  My husband ordered the grilled salmon blackened, both overcooked. If you can&#39;t properly cook salmon or steak your shouldn&#39;t be in the kitchen. How dreadful........Both spinach sides were chewy and overcooked. I had large hard, uncooked lumps of potatoes in my garlic mash.  This location may be to &#34;busy&#34; for its own good, we won&#39;t be back.

I am the usual foodie and have been to many restaurants across the U.S. and overseas and I have never once left a review about any restaurant. The reason for this review is because our waiter not only deserves the recognition but a trophy in my book. From the moment he greeted, to helping us pick and choose on the menu and to the second we left the restaurant, the best service and attention anyone has ever given us. Chris from the Cheesecake Factory in aventura is someone that every place of business needs. Thanks once again!!

I always go to cheesecake and forget to write my review I guess that&#39;s because I&#39;m always wrapped up in their huge menu. I give it 5 stars because they go above and beyond with food. The wait time is almost always the killer I hate going without making reservations or walking the mall until it&#39;s time to be seated. I&#39;m thinking they should do call a heads but the food is so good you generally forget how long you&#39;ve waited... TWO WORDS SHRIMP SCAMPI
While the food can be decent at times, getting your order correct can be a challenge. Favorite cheesecake Red Velvet hands down.

I have given this Cheesecake Factory many many chances, different days, different times, different company. I was hoping it could become a regular staple for me, as it is around the corner from where I live. However, after every Cheesecake Factory experience, I was underwhelmed and under satisfied, hoping for a more pleasant experience. I had been going to Cheesecake Factory since I was a little girl. As of late, the portions have gotten smaller, the quality has gone way down, and the service has become quite non existent. I leave hoping there could be a redeeming factor, luring me back, but I am sure I have reached my last visit. The server was rude and unaccommodating, the wait for the food was long, and the food was so blah. Blah=boring and tasteless.

I attempted to order food over the phone because I had to take my lunch so I could not sit in, to only be put on hold for a total of 20 minutes. I hung up and called back again and patiently waited for about 10 minutes to speak to a manager or anyone. At this point I didn&#39;t care who I spoke to, I simply wanted to order food. I called about 3 times in total for absolutely no reason because I didn&#39;t even get to order because no one answered. Crappy service!

Some of staff (particualrly the one who&#39;s disignated to take to-go orders) is absolutely insufferable. Whenever I ask if my order is ready, I always get a slight attitude, as if it&#39;s such a bother to inform me that the order is ready, to prevent wasting my time; Not to mention there is a terrible system for knowing when your order is ready. In fact, there is no system at all, except waiting around, and then standing in the pickup line to ask staff that will clearly ignore you because they seemingly don&#39;t want to be bothered. Either that, or probably because they can&#39;t hear you over their obnoxiously loud banter and laughter they&#39;re sharing with co-workers while customers are trying to get their attention. It&#39;s very unprofessional. All this wouldn&#39;t cause me to leave a negative review except for the most surprising thing I witnessed here. I overheard one of the workers talking amongst another right in front of me (softly, but loud enough for me to hear) stating, &#34;I can&#39;t believe this guy keeps asking me if his order is ready, like I&#39;m supposed to know??&#34; And they both proceeded to laugh. I noticed that a customers food was left on the counter for about 7 minutes, until the employer finally brought the ready food to their attention, so you&#39;re damn right I&#39;m going to ask every 3 minutes if my food is ready, after waiting 30 Goddamn minutes. Never eating from this place. Great food, but horrendously unprofessional. So unfortunately disappointing, considering it&#39;s a quality restaurant. I hope this review and others will change the way certain areas function in this facility.

Excellent place!  All the food is very good a big plates  <br>The cheesecakes are the best!<br>Must try the philly steak and the chicken Madeira <br>The only problem of this location is that always is so so crowded. So we ready to wait for your table <br>Definitely I will came back
We just have another great dinner here with the family , thanks to our waiter Cris ! Salmon and shrimp scampi are the best ! Of course the cheesecake too !
Food is always delicious! I always stick to the chicken madeira. The chicken is soft and juicy, the sauce is incredibly flavorful. Love this place (:

I was reading a lot of bad reviews about this restaurant but I think I had lucky today because for me was really good service and food. My server his name is JOHNNY C. was really amazing. As soon we sat on the table he came with bread which was really good and take our order for drinks and I told him want some French fries like appetizer for my baby and 5 minutes my baby got his fries and the drinks the same. After that I ordered steak tacos which I love them and my wife got chicken spicy with white rice was really good, dont remember the name of that plate, and before I left I asked Johnny surprise me with a cheese cake for dessert to take home and my wife told me was really good.I really have a good experience and the food was really good. The only thing I was looking was a lot of customers dont leave even 15% for tips and I imagine a lot your servers complaint about it or leave because since that place is a tourist they dont leave tips. I said this because your tables are really close each other and u can see how much tips left for the servers and it is really sad to have good service and food and left nothing for them.Thanks for the great service and food going to come back again.

Table was dirty. We had to ask several times before someone came to clean it.<br>Salad was served with stale/burnt garlic bread.<br>Ordered a filet Mignon- medium rare- what I got was cooked medium.<br>Won&#39;t be back

Completely mind blown......so last night was my birthday and I agreed to have my birthday dinner at Cheesecake Factory because that&#39;s all I&#39;ve been craving so I get to the location before my date and I was sat down the waitress asked if I wanted something to drink and some bread, I sat for 30 mins maybe more with no drink or bread nor a waitress coming to my table even asking me if I was ready to order. I never felt so invisible in my life, I literally told my date to not park the car because we I was going to leave, I got up from the table and walked away the host seen me leave and didn&#39;t even say anything, completely disappointed not sure I&#39;ll even come back to a cheese cake factory again you can even roll back the camera footage if there is any to see how long I was sitting there unattended
I always come to Cheesecake Factory for their awesome food, but the host is shitty, rude, doesn&#39;t know how to treat the costumers, and the manager doesn&#39;t notice this errors !

Same classic Cheesecake Factory with good food. But TERRIBLE SERVICE. Starting with the bathrooms were by far the worst I&#39;ve seen out of paper, dim lit and unkept. The hostess decided to yell names instead giving buzzers or ticket numbers, in a crowded entrance area with a very diverse group of tourist so names were often mispronounce and therefore skipped/removed from the waitlist. Then it got worse stereotyped by our waiter. Took our order and never saw her again, had to ask other staff for refills, to go boxes and to find our waiter for a check. When we asked for the check the waiter responded rudely &#34;I&#39;ve got it right here&#34;... the check wasn&#39;t in the possession of the waiter. Finally 5-10 mins later we had our check not a thanks come back and see us BUT, instead both checks are in there leave me a copy and my pen. <br>Side note: I worked in the food service industry in my early years I get that it&#39;s challenging and can be extremely fast paced but at the end of the day customer service is a priority especially in the service industry.

I usually enjoy eating at restaurants of this franchise. This time was different... While staff was friendly as usual food wasn&#39;t very good. <br>I ventured in the Sunday brunch menu and found &#34;chilaquiles!&#34; - one of my favorite Mexican dishes. <br>The plate came in with a generous portion as it is typical of The Cheescake Factory, but it looked like a large bowl of Nachos with pieces of scrambled eggs and a few chunks of fried pork (carnitas). It didn&#39;t look  like chilaquiles. <br>Maybe the item was incorrectly named and should have been labeled as &#39;Breakfast Nachos&#39; or it simply was a rendition created by someone who has never eaten Chilaquiles. <br>Either was it was just a bit disappointing. However the friendly staff and people around me helped had an overall good brunch experience.

The reason I like the Cheesecake Factory is, the wide selection of things AND the fact it&#39;s consistent, everything on the menu is super delicious! (And bear in mind I am super picky) so in short, I highly recommend this place!
Always bad experience here at this chessecake factory.. food good but service pessimist....

Cheesecake factory chain is like any chain, giant portions for family with ok food.  Of all the Cheesecake factory restaurant I been to in CA and FL, I liked this one better. They know how to make the Cajun Jambalayan pasta extra spicy without making it salty as hell like the other restaurants.  I still love me some Godiva cheesecake. <br><br>Overall 3/5 its aok in my book.
There was a hair on my American Burger. It shows the kitchen is not clear at all. When you give a order you should double check your plate.

Always been a fan of good tasty food; but the last time I had visited Cheesecake factory the food and service was very bad.<br>We waited over an hour to get our food and finally as it arrived nothing special.
Everything is good here. Love spinach dip and my favorite is fried mac and cheese. Ive ate so many things on their menu, everything is so good!

I was on vacation with my dad in Florida and we decided to check out this restaurant being that all the shopping in the mall had us starving lol. It was kinda crowded inside and we waited about 15mins for a table. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant was just lovely, reminded me of the Roman times. Ceiling artwork is fantastic! Our waitress was really awesome at explaining the menu and answering any questions we had. Let me just say, the portions are HUGE! Two people can easily share from one entree. Our dishes were so delicious and flavorful. The bistro shrimp pasta was to die for! Never had anything like it. My father got the lasagna and said it was really tasty. I also ordered a strawberry daiquiri and it was a little bit too sweet (didn&#39;t taste like it had any alcohol). For desert we ordered the chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake (with Nutella on top) and it was so creamy and fresh. I don&#39;t know if all the cheesecake factory&#39;s are the same but I&#39;m praying when I go to the one in NY I have the same experience I did here.

OMG!! <br>Went to The Cheesecake Factory Aventura Mall for dinner tonight.<br>Decided to quickly use the restroom after placing my order. <br>I walked in, took one look and immediately turned around and left the restaurant.<br>One thought.....If the restroom was allowed to go sooooooo unattended, what say the kitchen??!!<br><br>I have been in some really bad public restrooms but this one took the cheesecake.

The first time I went to Cheesecake factory was 10 years ago at San Franciso, CA.  I loved it and I went to Cheesecake factory whenever I went down to States.  <br><br>Of coz, same this time at Miami, FL. The menu  and the food quality pretty much the same (above average).<br><br>The portion was huge and I never can finish it.  The cheesecake was awesome!! <br><br>Never go wrong at Cheesecake Factory

On a date night with my husband visiting Aventura mall, we decided to have dinner here on a weeknight. We arrived around 5pm before the dinner rush so we were seated within 5 minutes. <br><br>We were seated in a cozy booth and our server soon approached to take our drink orders. She was pleasant and gave us extra time as we decided on what to order from their huge menu....<br><br>***The only complaint I must add was dirty small plates when we were seated. <br>Seems like they don&#39;t take the time or measures to properly clean their plates... We just used our napkins to eat the bread that they provide at the table and didn&#39;t want to ask for any &#34;new&#34; plates. <br><br>We were in the mood for a burger (and didn&#39;t want Johnny rockets upstairs) so we decided on the Kobe style burger and the Americana burger. I must admit we were a little optimistic about THIS place for burgers-BUT they were surprisingly good. <br><br>I devoured the Americana burger which has a delicious &#34;secret sauce&#34; which is a combination of ketchup mayo and what i believe are chopped capers ? With a slice of American and cheddar cheese, you cannot go wrong.  My husband had the Kobe style burger which he said was good, but wasn&#39;t crazy about the sweet taste of the BBQ-like sauce mixed with the onions and mushrooms.  <br><br>For dessert we decided on the Reese&#39;s PB chocolate cheesecake - amazing and delicious! Worth every bite and every calorie. <br><br>Service was good and our waitress was attentive to us with refills and extra napkins. <br><br>A good dinner, a good experience.

I had the new cheesecake flavor- birthday cake with all the blue,pink and sprinkles. Worst cheesecake I have tried ever at The Cheesecake Factory. The cake, frosting, and cheesecake sections all tasted horrible.THe chocolate and strawberry sections taste the same- looks like its just colored differently. It had an identity crisis. I also tried the avocado rolls- tasted good but very greasy.

Giving 4 stars because they no longer have my favorite cheesecake. I was sad to end my dinner without it. Overall the food and drinks were good. The filet mignon could&#39;ve been seasoned a little better but still tasty nonetheless.
Restaurant was not that full and we had a chance to cacth a waiter n everything served at once. Still i couldnt get my shake yet !!!!

I have gone here since they have opened and usually it&#39;s good. Today was horrible!! Everything they brought was bad but when I told them that the salmon, after I told him it tasted bad, the waiter took the salmon off my plate (without asking me) and said they will fix it. He came back 25 minutes later with the same salmon that had my bite marks on it and said they fixed it. I asked for dressing  Nd he gave me a little Container of dressing (enough for 1 piece of lettuce) and itt took over 20 minutes to get the dressing. I asked for almond slivers and he brought bread crumbs trying to convince me it&#39;s almonds. I asked for eggs on my salad and he said that they ran out of eggs. So many things went wrong today that it&#39;s too much to write.... the manager came up and apologized and did nothing else.. said &#34;so sorry&#34;... bathroom was so disgusting too!! Not one stall could I use.... I will start visiting other restaurants... not sure what is going on at this location.....

Normally I&#39;d never give 4 stars to a chain restaurant such as The Cheesecake Factory, but when I met some friends for dinner here a few nights ago, I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here. <br><br>One of the things I noted in a past review of another Cheesecake Factory location was that I felt they needed to reduce the huge size of their portions to something a bit more manageable, and at the same time reduce their pricing accordingly. I&#39;d always felt like a stuffed pig after eating at one of these restaurants, and would leave nearly as much uneaten food on the plate as I&#39;d consumed, as their portions were so large. <br><br>During this weekend&#39;s visit, it seemed they finally got it right. I ordered the chicken and cashew salad from their &#34;specialties&#34; menu. It was $12 which is reasonable, the portion size was manageable (though there were only 3 or 4 small strips of chicken in the salad - a bit on the stingy side) and for the first time ever at one of these restaurants, I felt I had enough room at the end of the meal to enjoy a slice of their namesake dessert - cheesecake. <br><br>I&#39;ll also say that, though parking was next to impossible on this night (I ended up parking about a city block away and hiking), our party of 4 was seated quickly, especially considering the place was full of patrons. Also, the service was excellent on this night, our waiter was attentive and stopped by several times to offer refills on water or drinks, the food was served relatively quickly and the staff was friendly.

Every time I come to this location I always have a problem, the food is amazing but the hostess and servers are really rude. They take forever just to greet the table, take forever to come back with out drinks or bread. The hostesses are really rude, I ask if we can seat somewhere else because the table they were giving us were next to door where everyone comes in and out. I ask if we can have a booth and they told us no but 10 mins later they sit a couple. Very disappointed because I really love the food.
Wait time was exactly what they projected. Server was prompt and kept drinks refilled. Refills are key after a long day in the Miami sun! Food was wonderful.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my all time can&#39;t go wrong favorites!!! The food is delicious and the portions are extremely generous :D <br><br>My favorites here are:<br><br>- their complimentary fresh bread assortments with butter <br>- the orange peel chicken <br>- the chicken Marsala <br>- crispy crab cake bites<br><br>They offer a great variety in their menu and most places are conveniently located near shops, malls, and movies :P <br><br>And last but not least, they have the BEST cheesecakes and cheesecake variety ever!!! <br><br>Tip: if you are a tourist this place is an american staple you must try!! Definitely an experience you won&#39;t regret ;)
I ordered a salad and the menu mentioned that it has avocado inside, but when I see it has no avocado, server did not give us any explain.

Doing my monthly greedy cheese cake run w/ the wifey to get our (2) Lemoncello Torte Cakes and Trying a Raspberry Lemon Cheesecake, would have them five stars if they would&#39;ve chopped up the fresh strawberries we always pay extra for hmm, might just stick to Sawgrass and Las Olas. Tsk-tsk!

I used to come all the time here, but this time was awful! The service was below average. Even though the server was very nice he never refilled our drinks something that is not acceptable. Then I order my usual dish: carbonara pasta. First they bring me an empty dish of pasta so I told them to bring the usual amount of pasta. Then when I tried it the taste was disgusting! Super mega salty, the bacon was not cooked well, the pasta undercooked. I had to return my dish and ordered chicken strips with French fries. I ended eating alone because the whole party was eating, even though the dishes weren&#39;t as they used to be. Furthermore the server never pick up the things empty from the table and the table was a total mess. <br>When I asked to speak with a manager the only thing she told me was &#34;I apologize&#34; and she left. <br>Now I understand why the place is almost empty now, without long queues as it used to have. <br>I won&#39;t come back.

Food was very good...their cheesecake is my favorite but their service is the worst...I ordered to go and stood at the counter for a while and 2 peoples was working in there till I asked them can I order then she said you have to wait for cashier and I waited like 10 mins...I understand if it&#39;s not your duty to take order but why would you say it at first place so I know what&#39;s going on!!!

Out of a party of three, two of us got either an allergic reaction or food poisoning.  I called and The Sr. Manager, Brian, said he would investigate and get back to me, but he never did, so I had to call back on the third day only to be told that no other customers complained.  I guess an allergic reaction or food poisoning cannot happen to only two people since they need to get three complaints for it to be taken seriously.  Not to mention how filthy the bathrooms were and all out of toilet paper.  They are always crowded so customer satisfaction is not a priority for them.

I went to the restaurant to grab a piece of their cheesecakes after watching a movie at Aventura Mall.<br><br>We arrived after 11pm and the waiter decided to serve us. He was extremely nice, one of the nicest waiters I&#39;ve seen in a long time. We could see that he was happy to work there and very happy to serve us. <br><br>He suggested his favourite cheesecakes.They were all very good. The banana cheesecake was simply amazing - extremely creamy and light ! <br><br>I strongly recommend this restaurant for a quick and delicious snack !

This is the first time I visited this location. Normally I would rate it 5 star, but the service was horrible and the food was lacking.<br><br>First, the waiter took about 10 minutes to take our drink order. From there, it did get a little better, but not much.<br><br>As for food, the chicken romano was the worst I had ever had. It looked like they cut a chicken breast into at least 3 layers, it was that thin. Half of it was just burnt breading with no meat visable. Besides from that, I think they only put maybe one tablespoon of marinara on the pasta.<br><br>Luckily, I was on vacation and will not be visiting this location again.

I love cheese factory but this one is always always every crowded. This is review isn&#39;t based off the food cause the food is great. Just the service is slow you have to wait doesn&#39;t matter what day of the week it is to get a table. This location is always loud too and I understand it&#39;s in a mall but it&#39;s overdone.
Great bartender!! She is amazing!! She made us experience wonderful!! The soup was very good like always!!

The restaurant was very crowded and noisy. The server was friendly and attentive. The decor is beautiful and clean. I enjoyed my Chicken Romano because I love the flavors however it was served cold today. My husband enjoyed his chicken Madiera
