NASTIEST SERVICE STARTING AT THE FRONT RECEPTION (Valentina was RUDE AND WOULD NOT GET A MANAGER AFTER I REQUESTED ONE.)  After waiting a little by time for the table for five our table was filthy.  I asked The manager Richard to please have it wiped down and he requested one of his staff to wipe our table down and replace our table ware.  The guy came over and wipe down two of our five and then never replaced our dirty table ware.  This place is disgusting and they couldn&#39;t care less about providing a pleasant experience.  I couldn&#39;t believe the manager Richard could not even make sure we were taken care of. They need to take a lesson from our wonderful waitress.  Polite and courteous!!!<br><br>I never want to return here again.  Needless to say I&#39;m not willing to eat the food if our table is this filthy and being wiped down with a rag that looks like it&#39;s been used for a week.

I went for lunch and had the fried calamari and fish tacos. Everything was ok. The fish needed salt but the fried calamari was PERFECT!! The best thing I had was the red velvet cheesecake!! Service was good also.
This place is always busy and long lines but so worth to wait. The food is delicious. No wonder it&#39;s one of my favorite places to eat. I will definitely come back when I&#39;m in Miami!

Located in North Florida at the premier shopping Destination with is Aventura Mall! I was worried that the service may be slow but after visiting twice I found it great both times. <br><br>The quality of the food was top notch, I enjoyed the Southern Fried Chicken Slider and the fried Macaroni and cheese balls, both of my favorite menu items!  The bread they serve ahead of time is delicious as well!  Having to choose from 50 kinds of Cheesecake is daunting but the Ducle De Leche is my favorite and never disappoints, the best Cheesecake we have ever had!  I live the lemonade drink with the sugar coating around the rim, with our dessert we also enjoyed a delicious Peach Smoothie drink, I could go on and on about the great menu items!  <br><br>We were here during the week, so I assume on weekends there would be a large wait! I would also recommend valet parking since you can never find a parking spot in this mall.

By far the best location. The service is always great and the wait is usually very short even when it looks packed. If you are into pasta dishes, I highly recommend the Chicken Piccata and the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, it is a big portion so be ready to take some home for leftovers.

The food is predictable and good.  The portions are large.  Our server was polite, sweet and knowledgeable.  The prices are reasonable.  But -- and this is not particular to this particular restaurant in the chain, it is endemic -- the noise level is atrocious!  Worse than the adults are the ill-behaved children, who are allowed to scream, yell and raise their voices without their guardians lifting an eye fro their telephones.<br><br>In this restaurant, in particular, I noticed that our tabletop was in dire need of refinishing.  The shellac or topcoat was peeling and cracked.  I found it discomforting.<br><br>I will probably return, for all the positive things I&#39;ve said about Cheesecake Factory.  I know what I face when I enter the door.
Food was fine. Server was fine. Both the women&#39;s and men&#39;s bathrooms were an absolute wreck.

We came at dinner time. The service was lousy. The waitress was very inept whenever she was helping us which wasn&#39;t very often because she was never around. We were there for 2 hours due to her horrible service. We didn&#39;t mind the time though as we were having dinner with friends.<br><br>The food was decent. I ordered the Old Fashioned Burger, which was cooked medium properly. It took at least 5 minutes to get mustard, which I had to get a different server to help me with that. <br><br>The prices are reasonable given the portions and they have a very diverse menu with selections to please almost everyone.<br><br>The ambiance was very dark and loud. We had to use our cell phones to read the menus and we had to talk very loud to hear one another.<br><br>I typically avoid chains and I will avoid this one in the future.

Went here with my mom for Mother&#39;s Day brunch. I&#39;ve visited this location a few times over the years and nothing has really changed. I think people were already waiting to come inside before 10am because when we got there at 10:15 they were already busy. I only had to wait about two minutes for a table. Instead of seating us at a booth, we were in the seating areas here it was two to a table. I would&#39;ve rather had a booth because I and another patron felt a little clustered being so close to the tables. I had the four cheese lunch pasta and mom ordered the Brulee French Toast. Our bread was good too. We now know that the best time to come to this restaurant and do some shopping is around lunch or brunch time.

Going to the Cheesecake Factory in Aventura is always a hurdle because parking sucks. The establishment and food is always reliable. What&#39;s to love on the menu you say? Steak Diane, the wine drenched angus steak with mash potatoes and onions (my most recent fave), the spicy chicken chipotle pasta, and the chicken enchiladas (with accompanying white rice and black beans). The avocado wraps make great appetizers (if you can squeeze that in with the main plate). The hefty portions are beyond generous. The Ultimate Red Velvet cheesecake and fresh strawberry cheesecake are both delicious but the main dish usually never leaves much room for dessert. This location as well as the ones in Dadeland Mall and Pembroke Pines Shops are suitable for a dinner with the family or a brunch with friends. I came here for birthdays (mines and family members) and graduations (high school and university).

Delicious Food, the lunch specials are awesome because they are filling, include multiple sides, and affordable. However it&#39;s extremely busy here they forget stuff because it&#39;s so busy had to remind staff twice about bringing us a high chair and they forgot to make my son&#39;s kids meal but they did make it right when I reminded them of it. Maybe things would flow better if wait staff had less tables to manage all at once split them up a little bit more all in all great place !

After looking forward to going to the Cheesecake Factory for our family outings for the past 15 years, last night had that all come to an end....it all starts at the entrance when you leave your name. Apparently the woman at the front entering names in the system has a hearing problem- which is fine. People with disabilities need to work as well and I am happy Cheesecake Factory supports this...anyway she did not enter correct party amount in system so after waiting almost an hour for a table, turns out we would have to wait again as a result of her incompetence...then the condescending manager comes over and instead of apologizing for the confusion or even offering our party of 8 something to drink, we were told we would have to wait an additional 30minutes. All this because the girl at the front could not hear anything correctly.  So no apology....no compensation...no courtesy...disgusting staff. Horrific management...this place was once managed and staffed by normal people whereas now it&#39;s all down hill....tried the new Tap restaurant in mall...awesome!!!

This place has been my families go to while shopping since I can remember and to tell you the truth it does a great job to feed hungry shoppers! Huge plates that we always order to share so everyone gets a little bit of everything. <br>Our faves:<br>- sweet corn tamale cakes<br>- avocado egg rolls<br>- chicken Thai wraps<br>- sliders <br>- bistro shrimp pasta<br>- banana cream cheesecake<br>- clam chowder (soup of the day)<br><br>We have tried a whole lot more and cannot complaint. You&#39;ll make a line to sit here for sure but it&#39;s service is fast and they take big groups.

Usually dine in the Pembroke Gardens location, but was convenient since I did some midday shopping. Was packed as usual, but don&#39;t mind waiting. Asked to be seated outside since it&#39;s a faster wait... I guess I didn&#39;t get the memo sitting outside = getting crappy service. 1) waiter took forever to greet 2) waited another 10 minutes for water and lemonade 3) another 15 for bread 4) another waiter said he&#39;s taking over from here on &#34;great, better service&#34; I though to myself ... NOT! 5) someone else brought us the food 6) didn&#39;t see my waiter for another 10 min after I was done with my lunch 7) had to ask ANOTHER  waiter for a to go box 8) asked ANOTHER waiter for the check and a to go cheesecake, he himself told me he couldn&#39;t find my waiter. 9) was on a timed lunch due to the fact my friend had to pick up her son. The whole lunch took us way over an hour. <br>Will NOT be returning back. BOTH servers were horrible.

All of our dishes were mediocre. My two friends enjoyed their meals mostly because they were starving...<br>Could&#39;ve gotten better quality at a diner. I ordered the Renee&#39;s lunch special (half a turkey sandwich, mixed green salad, soup of the day which was a shitty loaded potato soup with bacon and green onions). Soup tasted like canned soup.Went with three other people and two of them ordered the mahi-mahi fish of the day, they asked for it blackened, and it wasn&#39;t even close to that. Presentation was similar to middle school cafeteria food. I used to love their firecracker salmon rolls. Today we were given a plate of 93% red cabbage and 4 measly rolls. For $11.<br><br>Boyfriend and I&#39;s bill came out to $48 for garbage food. <br>Never again, ruined my day. Also, they brought me my Renee&#39;s special without the soup and that left me wondering how long it takes to ladle already made soup into a bowl. Told the waiter I was disappointed with my soup. He did nothing but half-heartedly apologize. <br>I left hungry. I want my money back.

Every time  I go to the aventura mall I stop by this place and get a peace of cake to go, I never stayed for eating but looks good, I&#39;m not a cake fan but I&#39;m starting to be so definitely recommended
This has a great food choice and the maintenance is at a decent speed and my whole family loved it and that&#39;s what&#39;s it&#39;s worth

Nothing special about this place. Food was about average and the service wasn&#39;t that good. The wait wasn&#39;t long but it was mid week. If you are in the mall there is better places but if you aren&#39;t sure what to eat there is a lot of variety.

The food is good ... when you finally get it and if your lucky you&#39;ll also get what you ordered. Though if they are remotely busy stay away! Took 20min for drinks to be delivered after waiting close to 10 to be able to order them. Refills were always slow and not timely in being noticed. Took 20min for 2 pieces of cheesecake. Got so tired of waiting for our CC to be picked up fished enough cash up to just be able to leave! Took over 2 hours for 4 people to eat!

Parking:  Terrible at all times of the day.  I would recommend parking near the Macy&#39;s Women and walking through the mall.<br><br>Dining In: Wait times are ridiculous! They tell you &#34;45 minutes&#34; and that turns into 2 hours because &#34;customers have their bills but they haven&#39;t paid yet! Sorry!&#34;<br><br>Times to Avoid:  Regardless of the day, do not go between 6:30PM - 9:30PM. You have been warned! <br><br>Take Out: I wouldn&#39;t recommend take out.  Got home and my food was cold and the sauce had bursted all over it.  I was told it would take 20 min, but it took 50 min. Paid $20 for crap.  <br><br>Complaining: Manager is hard to get a hold of! I was put on hold 5 separate times for 5 minutes or more each time.  It ended in him giving me a free meal.  That&#39;s the least you could do! I would go in person if you want to lodge a complaint.... :)
The wait at this restaurant is very long also the waiting area needs some organization other than that the food is good.

Came in on Jan 25 2016 around 8pm the manager was very rough on us we were a party of 10 told us 3 hrs wait then we told him to spread us out he sedan no way . If this is service that I don&#39;t knew what to say

Always a pleasure to dine here..... We arrived to a packed foyer, when checking in with the hostess we were told we would have a 30-35 minute wait. We took our buzzer and proceeded outside to wait.  To my surprise, our buzzer buzzed after about 15 minutes.  After being seated, we were greeted by our server Ashley, who I might add did an &#34;AWESOME&#34; job... She was very attentive and made sure that we had everything we wanted.  The food is alway great and the drinks even BETTER!!!!!
Always have a great time and great food at a Cheesecake Factory. We had two excellent dishes and a bottle of Cliquot Champagne. Great food great times.

The service is weak. I waited several minutes for the beginning of my service, even though I had already waited several minutes to sit at the table. The waitress was  in standard mode. I will give a discount because the restaurant was full and had insufficient staff. My spoon was dirty and was replaced without a single apology.<br>The service worked in mode inertia until the end.<br>One thing that made me uncomfortable was the absence of a towel or paper under the cutlery that we&#39;re put directly over a marble table, which is porous and therefore not very clean.<br>The food was satisfactory but nothing extraordinary. The price is low, but also was the service and food taste. The highlight was the cheesecake, but when he was halfway of eating it, the waitress brought the bill and I felt invited to go. Never again.

This review is NOT about The Cheesecake Factory - it&#39;s about Door Dash the service on The Cheesecake Factory website for online orders.  Last night we hosted a holiday party for our law firm at our managing partners home.  We decided to order 18 appetizers from TCF as everyone loves them and they are the closest to her home.  We used Door Dash the day before to input the $200 + order and selected delivery between 4:15 p.m. -4:30 p.m.  Now, we ran into traffic heading to her home to set up so we already knew a 4:30 delivery would most likely be a few minutes late (maybe even 30 min).  Acceptable.  The mall traffic was crazy, 95 was a mess.  However at 5:30 p.m. there was still no food/ no delivery.  That meant our food was ready at 4pm waiting, sitting, getting cold. We reached out to Door Dash who confirmed that the driver was running late and was not yet at TCF.  Which we knew because we called TCF directly.  We ended up having to pick up our own food and serve 18 appetizers (which arrived cold and soggy at 6:30 p.m.) 2 hours after the delivery was to arrive we had to reheat EVERYTHING.  Completely and horribly embarrassing.  My recommendation is that Cheesecake Factory disassociate themselves from this horrendous delivery service and use someone else.  DO NOT USE THE ONLINE ORDERING FEATURE.  GET IT YOURSELF.

I went to this restaurant today at lunchtime and it was packed. Despite this, I waited only 10 minutes to be sit. People from the reception desk were very efficient. The service took a while, but it was good too. The draft beer was nicely served and chilled. Ordered the filet mignon medallion with mash that was on the skinny menu. The food portion was not enough, little meat and not shaped like a medallion. Even being part of the skinny menu, I would think that for $ 18.00 at lunchtime, they could do more, as they did in the past. This dish was once very well served!
Had lunch here yesterday, the service was fast and the food was delicious. I had to go back to work afterwards so the lunch sized portion was perfect.

[Sub par service, way too much waiting] Went today for a quick lunch with my grandfather during my lunch break. When we got there, he noticed more than a handful of empty, clean tables outside so he sat down and I went inside to let them know. There was only one family in front of us, who were already being seated. Even though we already had a table, we still had to wait an extra 5 minutes before someone could walk us to the same table. I told them I was pressed for time and they said it was not a problem. When the waitress came, she took care of another table and didn&#39;t acknowledge us until we asked a bus boy to get her. About 10 minutes later, she finally took out order. It took about 15 additional minutes for us to even get bread or our drinks. After another 20 minutes of waiting (and no sign of our waitress) we asked another waiter to ask her to bring our food in to go boxes with the check. When it arrived another 5 mins later, it wasn&#39;t packed up so we had to package it ourselves and wait longer for to go bags. Overall the service was not great, the waiters and waitresses are hard to get ahold of and they weren&#39;t very polite considering it wasn&#39;t slam packed. She didn&#39;t even say thank you when she came to pick up the money. Needless to say, I will never go back there for my lunch break. On the bright side, the food tasted good while I ate it in the car on my drive back to work.. ‍

National Cheesecake Day, half price a slice of cheesecake = you get half a slice of cheesecake.  No joke!!!      I ordered a pizza off of the specialty menu.   It was supposed to have Italian meat on it (similar to prosciutto).   Where&#39;s the meat.....I only got 2 tiny pieces of meat, and didn&#39;t even taste the cheese.   I guess I am a home made pizza snob and happily so!!!     I will be skipping next years&#39; National Cheesecake Day at the Cheesecake Factory.

I&#39;ve gone to Cheesecake Factory many times but the food here by far was the best. The cooks must be breaking the &#34;cooking&#34; rules. It&#39;s hard to accommodate old school hungry Jamaican women, they all enjoyed and approved! Micheal our waiter was great too.<br>Teriyaki chicken, Jamaican black pepper shrimp (not Jamaica style but still good), shrimp scampi, salmon in miso sauce, Cuban sandwich, Orange chicken, Salmon Genoese and Chicken Madeira
The food was amazing and the service was even better. Thank you Tony and Monica for making our experience incredible.
Can&#39;t go wrong at any Cheesecake Factory.  Carne Asada steak medallions are very good.  It comes with corn and rice.  The chicken potstickers are rest as well.  Always excellent service here.

As always I always have a good experience here with the food and the service. My fiancé order the Smokehouse burger and I ordered the Shrimp and Chicken Jambalaya and it was my first time having the dish. It was so good.  I can honestly say that it was hot and fresh and the ingredients were well worth it.  The dish is kind of spicy but if you can handle the heat then definitely make it an option the next time you are there.  The only thing that I didn&#39;t too much care for was the Crispy Crab Wonton. When we ordered them they were hot and crispy but the filling with the crab was not too tasty for me. I can&#39;t really put my finger on it but I just didn&#39;t like it too much.  I&#39;ve had Crab Wonton from other Asian restaurants and they were really good. But this one I did not like.  But overall besides that the service was great and the food. I will definetly be back here over and over again. Just an FYI the wait may be kind of long but not too bad.

I&#39;ve written about Cheesecake Factory before and recently I&#39;ve found nothing to give any praise.  We tried the Cheesecake Factory in Aventura Mall and it was Okay, but it was over crowded and the noise level was off the charts.  It made dinning similar to eating at a rock concert with just you and your partner eating at a table while everyone else around you was yelling and screaming.  I find that more and more the case as we eat out as it seems Americans in general have lost their sense of decency and eating out anymore is nothing short of herding cattle to a trough and throwing in the slop.  The next popular restaurant will have you sitting on a toilet so you can just go while you eat and a large bowl on the table with all your food slopped in together.  Bon Appetite!
Chicken and waffles benedict for brunch...took almost 45 minutes to get my food while I waited at the bar. The egg yolks weren&#39;t runny at all, the food was lukewarm. Waste of time and money.
Awesome service! Ask for Josh Stevens, he&#39;s absolutely the most energetic, on top of things and detail oriented guy on the floor.

If I could give it minus a star I would. Went on Black Friday and boy black is what the experience was. It was its usual zoo like atmosphere at the entrance. I had been used to that. We got seated pretty quickly all in all. <br>First I order the chicken picata. It comes with a cream sauce on top. Never seen that, and for a good reason, when I taste it&#39;s awful. Picata is in a WINE sauce. So I send it back then order the chicken parmagnan pizza, whatever that is supposed to be. I said let me give it a shot. Pasta on top. I was starving. Two bites of it and I knew things were going downhill fast. So I sent that back. By then 0 for 2, I figured I&#39;d play it safe, and order NOTHING. Finally my family, who weren&#39;t satisfied either, ordered the cheesecake, which really, was just average. Nothing compared to Junior&#39;s in Brooklyn. 3 bites turned out to be my dinner.<br>Actually, the bread rolls were terrific and the high point of the meal. <br><br>In short, I used to like this place but it&#39;s gone down faster than hooker&#39;s head. Unlike a hooker I wasn&#39;t charged for sending back my dishes, which was the best thing I could say for a place I once held in esteem, but now am never returning too.
Omg the cheese cakd was delcojs i jad lunch here and km so happy . From the cske to the service im so freaking happy. Call for reservation.
My server was so sweet to my friend and I. The food was definitely served promptly and was delish!

Update** 5 stars for John M. Guest Services Specialist.  Outstanding customer service, John followed up with me in regards to my horrible birthday experience at the Aventura Location. He apologized and assured he&#39;ll address the situation. I just received a letter in the mail from ,he kept his word.
Eggplant parmigiana was not cooked all the way through. Mashed potatoes were not mashed. Subpar quality food.

Slow service my shrimp dish tasted very fishy, however after I told the server she sniffed the dish in front of me and walked away, still paid for it. Working in the industry what she did was wrong, still left her a good tip and walked away. Never coming back.
I love the cheesecake factory. The food is delicious, and the service is excellent.

Dog friendly environment. Love the fresh bread at the beginning of the meal. The food is good. Portions are big, and the desserts are yummy. I gave only 4 stars, because I had to wait more than 15 minutes to be seated.

I&#39;ve been a client of The Cheesecake Factory for over 20 years and fortunately I&#39;ve never been let down.  The service is usually fast and to the point, don&#39;t expect the polish attention you might encounter in a upscale restaurant,  this one has to do volumes. So you are in and out..  Their portions are huge, one ends up with the &#34;doggy Bag&#34; on the way out.  Anyways,  the reason I always come here is for their salivating Tex Mex rolls and ahi tempura rolls.  Always so yummy and my next favorite is their salads, love them all.. And of course their assortments of cheesecakes, but I always stick to the original with strawberries on top.  Soft and creamy.  <br>The uncomfortable wait standing against a wall with their beeper device in hand is worth it. Once one passes the preface the next won&#39;t disappoint.

Surprised that this restaurant doesn&#39;t have 5 star rating. It&#39;s my favorite place with my friend Geri, we go almost every Wednesday! I am a very picky eater since my new low carb diet and the waiters are extremely patient with all my questions, substitutions and nitpicks! Before the diet, my favorites were:<br><br>1. Avocado eggrolls<br>2. Chicken Samosas<br>3. Thai Lettuce Wraps<br>4. BACON BACON CHEESEBURGER (OH MANN!!!) (both off and on diet, lettuce wrapped, no bun!)<br><br>Our waiting times are from either 2 minutes to 10 minutes tops! Busier on weekend nights though! Really no complaints..<br><br>Favorite Drink: <br>I think it&#39;s called the Strawberry Creamsicle with Chocolate?<br>HEAVENLY!<br><br>I&#39;m obsessed with this place. And proud of it!<br><br>-Sabrina

Sorry. Can&#39;t give it more than one star as we went here around 3 pm (not rush time) and it felt like we were in a zombie apocalypse. It took us just 20 minutes to speak to the hostess! By the time we reached her we took a good look around and decided to leave as the place was out of control packed.
I love cheese cake factory ! Even when it&#39;s busy you don&#39;t wait to long to be seated .
Understaffed for a Saturday afternoon.  Inconsistency with their food from one visit to another.

Angel our sever was very nice and the food was great! Everything warm and came just in time to the table! We didn&#39;t have to wait long for service and overall even though is a chain restaurant I will always come back specially to this specific location
The lemon ricotta pancakes (served only for Sunday brunch) are to die for. They are also huge so they&#39;re great for sharing.

Make sure you come here if you like to be treated like they are making you a favor.<br>Terrible service in general, food waaaay overpriced for its quality and a feeling that you are never going to matter to them.

First of all, I am lactose intolerant. That being said, I went here because whenever we are in Miami my dad loves to stop by. <br>Aside from not being able to have any cheesecake, I like it here! It&#39;s consistent and decent priced food, with giant portions. It does sometimes take forever to get a seat, and there are often giant groups of tourists (like myself) that are hungry and cranky. However, once you sit down it feels a bit more calm.<br>I would recommend the cheesecake but I wouldn&#39;t know!

I usually enjoy eating at Cheesecake Factory, however, on this particular day the service was horrible. It was a Sunday and the wait for a table was 30 minutes plus. I didn&#39;t really mind waiting because it was understandably packed. When we were seated we sat for 15 minutes before a server approached us. That was only to say out waitress was working a &#34;double&#34;. The guy took our order for drinks and we submitted an order for food because there was no telling when we would get our actual server. This girl showed up 30 minutes after we placed our order. She didn&#39;t even check on our table after the food came. Needless to say no tip was provided. Worse experience with a waitress thus far.

I didn&#39;t think I&#39;d ever rate them this high, but I have to give the coveted 5 star award to the Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ve fallen in love with this restaurant all over again.<br><br>It&#39;s no wonder they have been around for so long.  The offer consistently high quality food at reasonable prices.  Atmosphere is always lively and service was excellent too.  Portions are huge and the place is a great value.  And who can say no to cheesecake?  And during October they have Pumpkin and Pumpkin Pecan cheesecake?  Who doesn&#39;t love that???<br><br>If you can avoid the madness and long waits during peak times, you really can&#39;t go wrong here.   Good job, guys!

Every time I am at Aventura mall, I eat here. The place is always busy, and the waiting time could be really ugly during eating hours, and the waiters / waitresses are all working really hard but still not be able to serve everyone in a timely manner since each is serving way too many tables. But those cakes!!! Also food here is decent for restaurants in a mall, and the selection is huge. But if you are in a big shopping mission, and you are running out of time, skip the place since it easily takes two hours away due to the lack in waiters/tresses. But again, those cakes!!! 75/100.

This isn&#39;t about the food at all, it&#39;s about the horrible state of their bathrooms. I have seen some bad bathrooms, but this literally takes the cake. Pungent urine smell, filthy and overall nasty. Do setting please.

Simply Incredible!<br><br>I met up here for dinner to catch up with my brother and we&#39;re greeted with drinks and fresh bread. We started off with the avocado egg rolls and the ahi carpaccio, two fantastic appetizers and then finished off sharing a pizza between us both. Daniel was our server today and was excellent at getting everything out in a timely manner. Between the great service and mouth-watering food I&#39;ll definitely be coming back here again :)
Rude hostess..didn&#39;t eat here.  I can&#39;t stand poor customer service.  We went next door to Rosalia.  The food and service were superb.

My girlfriend and I chose to go there for a date night, they gave us our table and I was starting to get upset because it took almost 30 minutes for a server to come to serve us. But the food was good though and especially the fried mac and cheese one of my favorite  side dish there.

This is the slowest restaurant I&#39;ve ever been to in my life. It took over 1 hour and 30 minuets to get our food and it took over 40 minuets to just get us seated. Don&#39;t get me started about how bad the service is it took the waiter 20 minuets to get our drinks. The food isn&#39;t  good for waiting over a hour and a half. It took almost an hour to get the receipt. I was about to leave without paying it took so long. I will never ever eat at one of these locations again.

I&#39;ve been going to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s for over 15 years now, and in all that time I would say they have been pretty consistent. It&#39;s not my first, second or third choice when dining out but when you want a reliable meal at a decent price, then this is not a bad option. <br>I usually go for a salad or sandwich. I also normally order Fried Calamari as an appetizer. Unfortunately at this location, the calamari wasn&#39;t as good as it usually is. <br>My least favorite part about this particular dining experience was that they sat us right next to a server station and 5 different servers were loud and complaining about all their tables. It made them look very unprofessional and made me feel uncomfortable. <br>Besides that, it is what it is.

Place is super busy for a Wednesday.. Didnt wait too long for a table..  server was SUPER understanding.. replaced drink with no problem.. brought out food SUPER QUICK!! Everything was hot and fresh!! Definite return trip!!

I absolutely love the cheesecake here...so many varieties. Favorites are the red velvet and the oreo dream. But the white chocolate raspberry is excellent also. To my surprise the food menu is very good too. My favorite is a Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp, the combination of flavors is perfect...from spicy to salty to sweet. Tres magnifique! The Fresh Grilled Salmon is very good also.<br>              I haven&#39;t had a problem with parking and the longest I&#39;ve had to wait was 20 minutes. Which they were prompted with, getting my group and I seated by that time or earlier.  This is a place I would definitely recommend and will be eating from again.<br>              Bon appétit!!

Im a huge fan of cheesecake factory for many reasons.  <br><br>The only bad side is the wait in the beginning.  Although they have a good system give out pagers while you wait, no one likes waiting.<br><br>OH, and I feel that when sitting in the mini tables its like were just too close to the next table.  Having a private conversation becomes a bit of a challenge.<br><br>Besides that the food is amazing.  The waiter service is great regardless if its busy.<br><br>The menu is overwhelming where some pages have aprox 30 different items with no visual.<br><br>You do have an option to sit outdoors which is very nice.<br><br>I always have a great experience dinning at this location.

It was very busy and slow service on a Sunday night when we went.  Overall It was good.  I had the Americana hamburger with special sauce and the 30th anniversary cheesecake.  The hamburger was so huge I only ate half of it so I could save some room for the cheesecake.  I liked the location in the Aventura Mall in Miami.
I am so Happy the offer a menu which offers a variety of plates with lower calories. Great!<br>I had the shrimp and angel pasta, which was great!

the service was terrible, we were waiting for the server 15 minutes to order drinks, dirty plates remained on the table all the time for dinner. waiting for the check 25 minutes, then another 15 minutes for brink it back! after there was no pen! asked another waiter about pen, she did not have one and told us wait our server! Are you kidding me???<br>Food was good as always!

It was our favorite place in Aventura mall. Tasty food, quickly service! Every time when we coming i feel dirty pages of menu...Buuuut!!!, last time we came day time and was shocked !! So dirty ! Both menus was with parts of food on  pages ...Disgusting to take it !! Knife dirty, table didn&#39;t clean well ! In darkness we didn&#39;t see it before! Now we will not coming again, because I can imagine condition of kitchen ... Disgusting  I know how should be clean in restoran .. And this is fall of managers and all staff !!!

I go to Cheesecake factory every time I&#39;m at the mall! That&#39;s how much I like it, but this time I Had a terrible experience! My visit was on July 23d, 2017. I invited my friend that was visiting from another country to have lunch with me at this location. After being sat by the hostess we waited around 15min and nobody approached us. So I stopped the server that was talking to the table next to us and sure saw that I was looking around and just ignored the fact we are not being helped and told her that we&#39;ve been waiting for a while. She didn&#39;t even smile or tried to be polite and just said it&#39;s not her section and she will tell our server. I work in restaurant bussiness and at my restaurant servers are tought what means team work! After waiting a few more minutes our waitress showed up chewing a gum and looking absolutely unprofessional! She approached me with an attitude and just asked &#34;Can I help you? &#34;. Excuse me??? Am I at the doctors office??? I just kept looking at her because I was so shocked that didn&#39;t know how to react. No apologies that we were waiting, no smile, no greating, Nothing! I literally read in her eyes how she doesn&#39;t want to deal with us since we already complained about waiting and that we&#39;re probably one of those tables that don&#39;t tip. Wrong! I always tip good 20% and all you had to do is just apologize and then do your job. I immediately asked for a manager and explained the situation and asked to be served by another waiter. Manager looked too busy to really show he cared. We had lunch and the girl brought the check, and still no apologies, no manager coming back and making sure if everything was fine at the end. I still regret that I was too nice and didn&#39;t ask for a manager to come back to make a big deal out of it. I should have asked what was that server&#39;s name so I could mention it here. In my restaurant I always compliment guests with a discount or a free desert if they didn&#39;t like something and I can&#39;t believe I had such a bad experience at this popular chain restaurant!

Nothing beats asking a simple question, then being told to &#34;stand off the side or in the corner, out of the way and wait,&#34; better than having your server yell at you after asking for your check, then asking for a manager, to have a manager lie to you then blatantly refuse to cover two sodas and a juice. The two managers on duty couldn&#39;t keep their stories straight and this was all stemmed from me asking, &#34; who do I check in with or how do you know I am here?&#34;. If you want to be publically humiliated by a server and hostess, don&#39;t let this place pass you by.

Terrible service. Management seems to have change or something but the food&#39;s quality has gone down, manager doesn&#39;t even care about your complaint and if you sit outside be prepared to wait another 15 minutes for somebody to even show up. Sucks because CCF is one of my favorite restaurants but this one, for the past year has been a rip off 90% of the time!

Now I understand why America is the fattest country in the world! The portions at The Cheesecake Factory are ginormous! <br><br>The food here isn&#39;t the greatest yet they are always packed! It must be the experience and/or environment that people enjoy? We waited approximately 30 minutes to get a table. Our server was very pleasant and made sure that we ordered something that we would enjoy. Did I mention that the floor was dirty underneath our table? I felt really gross knowing that there was food and garbage under my flip flops.<br><br>Me and my sister both ordered the angel hair pasta with jumbo shrimps. My mom got the original burger and my dad got the buffalo chicken wings as a dinner instead of an appetizer. The food took a longggg time to arrive because we finished the entire bread basket while waiting for our food. When we got our food, we were shocked by how huge the portions were. Me and my sister should&#39;ve shared the pasta because we didn&#39;t finish it and had it for breakfast the next morning. Basically, no one finished their meals instead of my dad...actually he didn&#39;t really finish because he gave 3-4 of his wings to us.<br><br>We never had a chance to try out their cheesecakes because we were always too stuffed. It must be awesome since it&#39;s called The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Would I go here again? This is my 2nd time but I would probably go again since they don&#39;t have any restaurants in Canada yet. But this wouldn&#39;t be my first or second choice...

Three (3)stars for the Chain, one(1) star for this location.  I really, really, really dislike this location, for a number of reasons, with food quality and service being right up there at the top of my list.  <br><br>The food chain on a whole: The service and food quality is just ok, the entree prices are fair, but the cheesecakes are very over priced, $8.00 per slice, nevertheless some of the cheesecakes are very tasty, though most are to rich and loaded with whip cream.  Some locations are way better than others, and some locations suck.<br><br>This location: SUCKS, this one and the one down south at Dolphin Mall, just don&#39;t!<br><br>Note: This particular location is always busy due to tourist so if your looking to come for an early lunch, or to be in and out, I suggest going to a different location. <br><br>I don&#39;t recommend this location, if possible go on the otherside to Grand Lux instead.  Next to Bloomingdales.
Excellent customer service with little to no wait! Took my family out to eat to celebrate a birthday. Worth your while!
This is the worst cheeese cake we ever been probably because is to busy lower the food standard

I never go out of my way to write a review unless the service was over the top or just terrible. After waiting half an hour for a table our server did not visit the table or take our drink order for over 20 minutes. We sat at the table waiting without bread or water. After finally taking our drink order he did not show up to the table for over an hour, no refills, dirty plates, etc. We ended up going out of our way to bother another server who i&#39;m sure had his own tables to worry about, and although he seemed busy the gentleman cleaned our table, refilled our glasses, and brought us our food in minutes. We are a table of TEN so it was not easy. The server who saved our wait was named Gabriel. He was so attentive and proffesional that it deserved a review. Thank you Gabriel for taking care of me and my family.

Me and my friends walked in and it was very busy. Kids were running a muck and knocking into adults that were all crammed at the reservation desk to get seats. <br>Where are the parents of the wild children running as if they&#39;re at disney world?  I don&#39;t know.<br>Anyway we finally get to the receptionist and my friend asked &#34;excuse me, how long is the wait.&#34;<br>Waitress with the long red hair said nothing. That&#39;s okay, she probably didn&#39;t hear us.<br>Again my friend asked another question to the lady. &#34;Excuse me?&#34;<br>After she finally gave us her full attention, she answered with a &#34;Yes?&#34;<br>OH lord this lady is trying it.<br>My friend asked for a menu  again (mind you, we asked her twice.)<br>Finally the lady gave us a take out menu...<br><br>Now if I wanted a take out menu, I would&#39;ve waited at the take out order line. The 4 of us were waiting to be seated or given a time for when the next table would be available. <br>*sighs* WE asked to know if we can get a better menu with everything on it. WE aslo asked when the next available table will be open.<br>The red head receptionist said &#34;We don&#39;t have anymore menus!&#34; and went on to the next person as if we were at a cafeteria homeless line and not a well known eating establishment.<br>Disgusted.. I left and went to nordstroms cafe which was way better when it came to customer service.<br>I understand that they were busy, but a lot of people felt stranded and nothing was organized. Plus me and my friends got attitude for asking two simple questions after we waited in line to eat at the Cheesecake Factory. because I have a zero tolerance policy, me  and the rest of my friends left and went somewhere that had everything in order.

I am only wasting 2 minutes of my life to say It is sad to see a place like this dropping the ball the way they are. My dinner last night was a disaster from start to end. But they don&#39;t care anyway, it&#39;s not that is going to affect the sales... NOPE! Sorry Bella Luna for being so stupid last night and not going over to you, won&#39;t happen again!

Cheesecake, cheesecake, cheesecake!  If you want great cheesecake in unfamiliar territory, this is the place to seek out, this location is no exception - everything else on the menu, you could probably find elsewhere, probably cheaper and better... I really, really hate the lines though!

Each time (4 visits) I have been here the service has been disappointing.  Service is always slow and the servers give stale apologies.  Some don&#39;t know the menu and the food comes out slow and is sometimes cold. I usually love the cheesecake factory because of there food and go back because of it but this is my least favorite location. I do not hope to be back to this location, they need to be better with their service.

had a 5 minute wait and was brought to our table shortly. <br><br>there was a mixup with our order and the waitress said that my friend had pointed to another dish (when he said he was pointing to the one below it). I didn&#39;t really think it was a big deal (i mean i would have just ate the wrong order but lightly let the waitress know) But I thought it would have been more professional to not abruptly accuse the customer by saying &#34;no you didn&#39;t&#34;  when the customer said they ordered _____, regardless of the fact of who&#39;s at fault.  <br><br> They should have rounded the corners and not make the atmosphere so heavy and awkward. My friend later requested to see the menu again and they both kind of realized how it was an honest mistake.  The manager later came to apologize for the mixup and got our orders in right. <br><br>I felt the meal kind of awkward the rest of the night though the waitress was really professional and did come back to see if we have everything we needed. <br><br>not big enough of a deal to not want to come back, but did change the mood.
The worse service and food ever!!!!!<br>Don&#39;t go there food is not fresh and cold and the manager don&#39;t even care when we waiting 2 hours for this horrible food !!!!

We usually have a great experience at the CF. Not their best effort tonight. 10 minute wait time, was quoted 20 was good. Food was good. The service was mediocre at best and the kitchen was S. L. O. W. Slow slow. Almost an hour to get our food. Wait person disappeared for 10-15 minutes at a time. It will be a while before we come back.
I love their avocado spring rolls and the wheat bread they serve fresh without charge. I also recommend the passion fruit iced tea and the Godiva chocolate cheesecake, just delicious!!!

I was just at the cheesecake factory and a ROACH that&#39;s  right a  dirty filthy ROACH walked across my table,and the server wanted to give me a piece of cheesecake to make up for the filth.I will never come to your dirty establishment again.The Aventura Cheesecake factory now has ROACHES walking across the tables.

We&#39;re creatures of habit so we usually stick to the same &#39;ol thing. <br><br>Humus here is great. Love the soft warm bread that comes with this appetizer. <br><br>For dinner we both opted for the Teriyaki Chicken. You have the choice of bone in or not; pick the bone in one since it seems much more moist. <br><br>And for desert, we always choose the Tirimisu desert, not the cheese cake. <br><br>So why the 2 stars? I believe Cheesecake Factory does many things well, but they only do cheese cakes exceptional. I ordered a steak one time here and it came overcooked despite me advising the sever that it has to be rare. <br><br>When the steak came that time, the plate was super hot telling me that the runner or server left it under the heating lamp too long and sure enough, it was medium. The server gladly took it back and the manager brought a new one to me. It was super rare which is fine and I enjoyed it. The meat was red but not a deep red color as when you would get beef from a butcher shop. This quality of meat was inferior and that&#39;s what I meant by their menu being large and serving it all. <br><br>Also, we ordered take out last week and were looking forward to enjoy our dinner while watching a move at the drive-in at Swap Shops. While we enjoyed our humus, when we finally got to the Teriyaki Chicken, there were no utensils. I called Scott the manager and he offered nothing but an apology. Now imagine you&#39;re in the middle of watching a movie, and about to eat your dinner, but now you&#39;re completely distracted because the moron handling the take out decides to not pay attention and leaves you no way to eat. So now instead of watching the movie, you&#39;re scratching your head on how you and your wife are supposed to eat dinner. Needless to say, management here needs much improvement. Or it needs to be replaced. Training is paramount and here it&#39;s lacking in the worst way.

Cheesecake Factory is always a favourite when we come to Florida.  The Jumbalaya pastas are fantastic, as are the hamburgers, salads, etc.  Of course, the cheesecake selection is amazing, and you can&#39;t go wrong.  I wouldn&#39;t advise the Spicy Crispy Chicken Sandwich - it was fairly boring.  Also, come early, as they are always busy.  Service ain&#39;t so hot anymore, but the food makes up for it!
Delicious food, great service! Everytime i dine here i order the tamales for an appetizer and the chicken madeira for the main course.  I can gladly say Ive never been disappointed. !

Waited about ten minutes for a table to only be seated next to a family of screaming kids. To my left, a dirty wall splattered with condiments over time. Food was ok at best and the strawberry caipirinhas were the worst. If the presentation is this bad in customer facing areas, god knows what the kitchen looks like. At the end of it all, slightly disgusted.

Love the location right inside the Aventura Mall, convenient after a long day of shopping.  It was really busy and crowded on a Saturday night but the service was still very good and fast.  The food is as good as it gets at a Cheesecake Factory.  <br><br>Love their menu which provides a large variety of dishes.  And now they have the new Skinnylicious menu items which provides the low-cal dishes.  Despite my best efforts, I do have one weakness which is their bread basket ... which I honestly try very hard to ignore but  that yummy soft warm bread calls out my name till resistance becomes futile.  Then, to feel less guilty, I&#39;ll have their tuna tataki salad ... perhaps accompanied by a glass of wine.  Ok, then after that, my second weakness kicks in... a little bite (or 2 or 3) of one of their famous cheesecakes.  So much for &#34;Skinnylicious.&#34;

This has to be one of my favorite restaurants. Whenever I go my go to orders are the da vinci, shrimp bistro or the pasta carbona. This place is amazing and if you love pasta this is where you should go.

OMG! YUM! Can&#39;t say the food isn&#39;t spectacular! Everything on the menu is to dye for. All 1 million calories of it. The Blackened Chicken Sandwich is yum!<br><br>The only reason they get 4 stars and not 5, is that if I ate here everday, i would way over 500 pounds. And I treat this lunch spot as a rarity. Shame!<br><br>Cause when I come here, I enjoy stuffing my gob!

Thursday night, restaurant was packed! I Understand why service was slow.. (Waiter was very nice). But we were waiting for the check, I saw 2 small cockroaches climbing the wall behind me. Didn&#39;t say anything because I work at a restaurant and I understand that wasn&#39;t the waiter&#39;s fault. But anyways, that shouldn&#39;t ve acceptable at a Cheesecake Factory. They&#39;re lucky I&#39;m nice because I know there are people who would have put up a show in order to get a refund and I totally understand that because you shouldn&#39;t eat with cockroaches near you.
Today in a long time I didn&#39;t enjoy my chicken ceasar salad. There wasn&#39;t too much chicken in it and there was a lot of dressing. Don&#39;t order it.

Can you give zero stars.  The absolute worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to.  Party of 9 and each dish came out one by one about 5-10 min apart from each other.  The last two never came out and one was a salad and other was pasta.  Not that freakin difficult to make.  Don&#39;t waste your time or money at this disaster of a ran place.  Then they came to say we screwed your salad up and we are making another one.  Then that one came out after everybody was already finished and it had zero dressing on it.  Can you say the worst service by far.
Excellent food.  Stuffed chicken enchiladas are awesome.  Complimentary wheat and sour dough bread is great.  The cheesecakes are fantastic but the strawberry shortcake is awesome as well.

Amazing machine of great desserts and if you add to that good entrees, you are in for a treat of tastes and senses. With that said, I have a hard time dealing with restaurants that take so long to get a table and the NOISE, man oh man, it is a noisy environment. If you can live with that, you need to know that you will eat very, very well.

I go into Cheesecake from time to time and sit at the bar just to grab a bite and enjoy a drink while I shop around the mall. I always receive great service from friendly staff and wanted to specifically point out a bartender named Jason who took excellent care of me with extensive knowledge of the food and drink menu.

Hugeee portions, great staff, great tasting food. Long wait &amp; the parking situation isn&#39;t the best. But it is still a good restuarant. Everyone does a good job there, it is just always busy. You can go get a bite after shopping all day or anything else. Great location.

Omg what a terrible customer service experience. This is my first time in this location, in a saturday afternoon, and I don&#39;t recommend it at all.<br>The food was OK, as in any other cheesecake factory. However, the place was extremely crowded, and after a 20+ min wait, I experienced one of the worst customer service experience of my entire life.<br>First of all, we ordered a Strawberry margarita and we got a regular one. We also ordered a beer and they brought it to us when we were finishing our food, after we remind the different server more than three times (the last time I inquired about the beer I ordered the most disgusting red hair lady almost yell at me that &#34;your server will bring that to you&#34;.<br>Finally the beer came (not cold), and finally we had to wait about 15min for the check. I decided to ask another server if he could take care of it, and same response (evil eye, rude manners, and a &#34;your server will take care of that&#34;).<br>Not coming back ever! You just lost 4 clients.

we went shopping at aventura mall and we were hungry so we stop by Cheesecake Factory......we were seated maybe about 10 minute and then we order drinks......we have order ribeye steak, grilled salmon and kid mini corn dog......the ribeye was kinda salty maybe too much seasoning on it so it was ehhh......the grilled salmon was just plain grilled salmon with veggie and mash potatoes......mini corn dog for my nephew was not quite good to him maybe he was used to the other type.....over all it was ok but not great maybe next time we will try other stuff.

This was a good Cheesecake Factory.  They were so busy but very organized.  We had the Orange chicken and the sausage and ricotta flatbread pizza.  Both were fresh.  The had a large selection of specialty drinks but we did not have one.  The menu is like a book.  We also were to full to have the cheesecake but have had it before.  It is so yummy.  Enjoy

Yes its a chain restarant but its so good everytime that i dont care!<br><br>Ive only been to this location twice and hurried on over here this time to get the lunch special on a Sunday afternoon. There&#39;s always a wait here, ive gotten over it and you should too. The firecracker salmon rolls are my fav appetizer and the spinach dip is yummy too. If you&#39;re going for the lunch specials i suggest you get the crusted chicken romano (with white sauce) delisshhhh!<br><br>Red velvet cheesecake is awesome too!
One of my favorite places! I love their avocado egg rolls. A little pricey but the portions make up for it. I recommend sharing with a date or a friend!
I&#39;ve been to this Aventura Cheesecake Factory a million times they always have great food and a friendly staff

We just came for dessert having already had dinner earlier. Spent over $30 for 2 slices of cheesecake and 2 cups of coffee. The cheesecake might as well have been jello instant box cheesecake for all the flavor it had, and the coffee was so bitter I could barely drink it. The cheesecake was grainy and gritty, and didn&#39;t have much flavor. The waiter was attentive, but a little pushy, seemed annoyed to be waiting on us for just 2 slices of cheesecake and 2 coffees. Was really trying to push the dinner menu on us and talking over us. Once he realized we were just there for dessert he kept trying to pressure us into different choices than what we wanted. Clientele was mostly bourgeois yuppie housewives in ugg boots who seemed to think the food was just this side of heaven. Maybe it was, but the dessert was very pedestrian. The atmosphere was like a noisy cafeteria, tables packed in so tight you are practically in the laps of the people next to you. They were herding people in and out like cattle. Don&#39;t get me started on the men&#39;s room. No soap, and looked like the aftermath of a monkey house territory dispute SO MUCH HUMAN WASTE EVERYWHERE. You would think a place with a name like &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; would at least have good cheesecake right!? Nope. Not even clean bathrooms.

Sat at the bar and was practically ignored both bartenders food took 45 min. Seemed like they had to many bartenders on service. They all seemed busy just not taking care of people sitting at the bar. My food was great. And a curly haired girl @ the dessert area was really fun and had great suggestions about the white chocolate macadamia but cheesecake thnx girl it was amazing!
Always enjoy the food served here.  Service is usually very good.  Sunday afternoon can be a bit crowded.

Well all cheesecake factories have the same look and food so if you&#39;ve been to one you&#39;ve been to all.<br>My favorite appetizer is their avocado egg rolls they are the best! The red velvet cheescake is amazing! <br>As for our experience today the server was very nice but the bread took forever to bring out. I had to ask for it several times. Also they brought out our dinner plates at all different times. This was kind of annoying.

We went on a Thursday around 2 pm for a late lunch. We were seated quickly,  and then just waited. We sat for 10 minutes before anyone came to our table. Our server was an older man named Bob. He seemed put out and bothered by waiting on us. Once our food came he never came back to check on us. We had to flag him down to get drink refills, cheese for the pasta and malt vinegar for the fish and chips.  The food was subpar. Not great,  but we were hungry and it was edible. Bob did make sure to ask if we wanted dessert,  then never came back to take our order. We had to flag him down again. The restaurant wasn&#39;t super busy. Bob seemed to spend a lot of time on the computers which happened to be next to our table.  When I got his attention and asked for the bill he huffed and got it and slammed it on the table. <br>We go out to eat all the time and have never had such poor service. Totally wasn&#39;t worth the high ticket price.

Service has really gone down at this Cheesecake. Went their a few weeks ago, the hostess was really rude from the beginning. Asked to speak to the manager she promised to take care of us and seat us at a good seat. That was clearly a lie. When we asked to be seated at a booth they told us that we had to wait for another 15min, we asked to speak to the floor manager. Explained to him our situation, without even finishing our sentence he had the audacity to say that we&#39;ll give you a booth because that&#39;s what you want. He didn&#39;t even apologize or took the time to listen to us, he automatically took defense of his staff and dismissed us. The food was as lousy as the servicw. Never again will I go to this place.

I will make this short.   Walked in    Told 5 min.  Went to look at cheescake. Saw people being seated after us.   Asked why.  They misplaced our ticket.  They went to seat us. Table was dirty made us walk to front and apologized.   Meanwhile were seating other tables of 2 befor us.  Pissed me off. Sat at diff table.  Complained to manager.  Se said she would speak to staff and apologized.  We got nothing but heartburn.  Bad service bad business.  I think hire ups should speak to that female manager.

The food is always amazing here! The chefs do a great job and their are so many options. We had the stuffed mushrooms as an app. The extra sauce was good with the bread too! I got the veggie burger with a salad, soooo gooood! And my boyfriend got a chicken dish with asparagus mushrooms and mashed potatoes. He loved it! <br><br>However my service was pretty horrible. Our server came up to the table and just looked like she was in the weeds. She took our drink and app order and quickly ran off to tend to other tables. She comes back with one drink. She forgot if I got a Pinot Grigio or Pinot noir. No biggy, it happens, but hey if your weeded you should probably write things down. The food runner that dropped off the app was very pleasant, she even refilled our waters. My wine got to the table mid app and we placed our food order. I asked for no tomato add avocado, and she seemed a little confused, she may have been new to the menu. Our server delivers the food and it&#39;s perfect but then she wasn&#39;t seen for a while. My boyfriend needed a water refill and wanted to look at the cheesecake list. When we were all done she stopped by and we asked for the check, she grabbed another water for my boyfriend and we decided to not get a cheesecake. We cash out and after the card was swiped I realize the check is wrong! She charged my boyfriend for an Irish coffee Manhattan (which was also delicious btw) and an Irish coffee. <br>A genuine smile, a sincere sorry, and a pen and paper would have gone a long way for this girl.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory restaurant that l have ever visited.  I went there today for a late lunch and really regretted it as soon as we were seated.  It was very noisy, the food l ordered took a very long time and the pizza was dry and burnt around the edges.  The ladies restroom was nasty.  The toilets in several stalls were overflowing and it seems like it had not been cleaned in weeks.  Not at all impressed with this restaurant.  Management needs to take steps to improve the overall operation at this location.

We have been to this particular location several times. There is always a long wait but the food is worth it. The food and atmosphere was great as always. The service was very good and the staff was very tentative and friendly.

I was in Aventura and I wanted to go grab lunch. I really wanted to go to the cheesecake factory and  have a red velvet cheesecake for desert. So I got to the mall and parking took around 10 min to find. When I walked in the host greeted me and I put my name down for a party of 2 and she said it would take around 10 min to be seated. We got called and then escorted to our table. When we got to our table I did not like the location of the table they were trying to give us. It was in a corner near the kitchen and a lot of movement went by there and I wanted to get a booth or a area not near the kitchen and where I would be able to sit next to my girlfriend. When I told the host that I didn&#39;t want to sit there and if he could accommodate us at another table.  He rudely said &#34;go back to the host desk and ask for a new table&#34;. This tone and comment just gave me a really bad impression and I wasn&#39;t going to spend nearly $80 dollars for really bad service. So instead of going to the host stand and asking for a new table, I went to another restaurant to ask for a table.

This afternoon my wife and I had lunch here. Our server was very nice and helpful. He was very understanding to my wife and brought take out boxes when we asked for them. Let&#39;s not forget the cheesecakes we bought to take home.

The wait wasn&#39;t long at all, maybe 5 min although it was very crowded there. We sat down, waited for our server. Took about 10 min for Jason G to greet us.. took another 10 min for our drinks... another 20 min for him to come and get our appetizer order... appetizer took another 20 minutes. Finally, he came again to order our food. I mentioned in the beginning it was a split check between me and my friend and she reminded him again before he took our food off the table and what do you know, he didn&#39;t split it. So i had to wait another 15-20 min for him to come back and to let him know it was suppose to be split. He took it back with an attitude (MIND YOU, HE HAD 4 tables. ONLY.) brought it back, we paid and he returned our cards another 15 min later. No &#34;have a great night&#34; just set it down on the table. Im sorry but if you want a great tip please give us good service. Speak to your table, be a nice human being. If you want good service, avoid Jason.
The food was as good as every Cheesecake Factory. The service left something to be desired.

We went to cheesecake factory and we had for our appetizer a southern chicken sliders it was very good. My entree I had a chicken and biscuit it is not like the traditional southern chicken and biscuit. The chicken is not fried and breaded. The biscuit was deliciou. For my drink i had a atrawberry cream sicle it was  worth it. It remind me of a grown up strawberry milk shake with alcohol.  If you are looking for a southern type of chicken biscuit try something else on the menu. The gravy was divine it had carrots and onions. The mash potatoes had a rustic taste to it. My husband had the turkey burger off the 500 and below menu. If you order the turkey burgers on the regular menu it is huge. Order the one on the menu that is 500 calories menu. The dessert I had a tiramisu cheesecake which was very delicious and my husband had the Craig crazy carrot cheesecake it was very good. The waiter was very tentative and nice so he deserve his tip.

I was here twice and both times it was good. Don&#39;t be fooled by a long line -- it actually goes pretty fast and you always can get a table (for two) within 10--15 mins. Skinnylicous menu is worth trying!

I have never gone back ever since my last experience. After waiting for almost 2 hours my boyfriend and I were finally seated after about 30-45 minutes of just sitting and waiting no one came and we left. I tried to reach out to management but they couldn&#39;t care less they&#39;re worried about their money instead if service. Otherwise Cheesecake Factory is known for their desserts which is why I gave 2 stars. But I don&#39;t even go for that because of how crappy the service is

Usually go to FTL (Las Olas Cheescake F) where service is terrible, but this location is even worse.  Don&#39;t ever go with children! I asked to reserve seating for 9 before our whole party arrived, they told me no problem, it was early (10:30am),.  When everyone arrived, they had done NOTHING and we still had to wait 20 minutes &#34;for them to put tables together.&#34; Annoying service, lack of basic customer thoughtfulness, little sensitive to family with children, despite extensive KIDS menu.  Will never return to another CF!

I absolutely love coming here! Super busy on the weekends; for a table for two its about a 20 min wait. During the week, the place is busy but getting a table is almost instanteous. Staff is friendly and quick. Food is good. The regular items on the menu are big portions so if you&#39;re not looking to throw away half of your meal than my advice would be to order off of the &#34;Skinny Menu&#34;. Less variety but smaller portions and less calories (if you&#39;re calorie conscious). Cheesecakes are exquisitely delightful! I&#39;ve tried many different kinds and can&#39;t always seem to finish them because they are very very rich and fill you up quick! Enjoyable place!

I went for dinner with my family and we had a great time. The service was fast, the food delicious and their juices tasted like fresh and made from the fruit. We already have plans to go back and try other dishes. My only issue with the place is that is loud, very loud, but that&#39;s not the business fault.

Food is good no different than any other Cheesecake Factory you go to obviously. But they have a horrible sewer stench if you are sitting in the outside patio. It was not a one time thing it happens a lot, and it takes away your appetite. I recommend sitting inside.

O.K. So it is a Chain Restaurant, but it is a GOOD ONE.  It just never fails.  If there was not a line, I would worry, but the line does move fast and you can always try to sit in the bar, if there is a seat there is no waiting.  They also have an outside patio to eat in when the weather is nice.<br><br>The food and service is good either place. It really is worth waiting for.  They are open for lunch and dinner and there is something for everyone.  I love the Lettuce Wrap and the Cobb Salad, the Hamburgers are delicious.  We never had a bad meal.<br><br>Aventura is lucky to have this gem.  Hope you enjoy it also.

What&#39;s not to like about Cheesecake Factory? <br><br>Most of their dishes are large portions which gives you somewhat of a satisfaction, but of course, there are the desserts. <br><br>My favorite things here are the Hummus, Teriyaki Chicken, and Tiramisu Dessert (not the cheesecake)<br><br>Anyone within the reading distance of my review should try these selections and lmk how happy you are afterwards. And if you&#39;re not, lmk where I can send you your money back! <br><br>jk. but you&#39;ll thank me for the recommendations.

The food is great. Although I had to wait quite long for my sandwich and later for my cheesecake. I had the Italian sandwich,  which is one of the best I have ever had. The service is good. I know when it is busy you don&#39;t think about it, but some more smiling faces would be nice. Overall a good restaurant with good service.

Say whatever you want about Cheesecake -- too many &#39;non-locals&#39; and foreigners, long waiting period, big portions, whatever... The haters&#39; usually end up coming the most.<br><br>If you&#39;re worried about waiting, then don&#39;t go to Cheesecake; for whatever time you spend bumping into rich foreigners, you&#39;d have wasted a well considerable amount of time.<br><br>It&#39;s a chain, folks, it&#39;s to be given. That being said, I did experience a long wait, and understanding the high-volume pace that a chain habitually brings, I had no problem waiting a few... a couple... alright, it was a long wait dammit&#39;, but I knew the food was going to be worth it.<br><br>Me and a friend chose to sit outside, and we were immediately spotted by our server. The menu, which should include a dawm encyclopedia, is undoubtedly one of the longest menus&#39; I&#39;ve taken to read. If this is your first time at Cheesecake, make sure you&#39;re good at narrowing down brackets.<br><br>My sever was extremely busy, yet she still had the skill to keep us contempt with bread and water refills. Furthermore, the food did come out in reasonable amount of time, and I really have to say our server was phenomenal, and this coming out of a chain.<br><br>I ordered a Chicken Madeira, and it was very tasty and filling, all of which I look for in a restaurant. <br><br>The anorexic-NYU hipsters can keep Per Se, I&#39;m happy with good ol&#39; CF.

Alright, Cheesecake Factory. You&#39;re fatty, overcrowded- and you&#39;re service really isn&#39;t the best.<br><br>Taking all of this into consideration, I want to let you know one thing: I love you. That shrimp bistro pasta thing is absolutely finger-licking good. I keep coming back for more. And the bread, oh... the bread with the butter... melting in my mouth. I want you. I want you IN ME and I want you NOW.<br><br>I&#39;ll be seeing you soon, my darling Cheesecake Factory.

We ate at this location visiting Aventura mall, and USA for the first time. I had fish tacos and my boyfriend had a chicken dish. Food was ok, and service ok - nothing absolutely extraordinary but we were satisfied. We asked for our cheesecakes to go. When the time came to paying the bill, we left what was asked for, plus a few extra $$ for tips. After the server picked up the check and counted the money, he quickly returned asking for us to follow the tipping guidelines on the bottom of the check asking us to add between 18-35% of the meal! I guess this is the norm in the US, but since it&#39;s our first time in the states we didn&#39;t know and it made us feel pretty awkward. I think a 18% tip is very high - and yes I know, it&#39;s a way to keep the wages down for servers, but 12-15 usd for one paying customer (and he probably have 30-50 customers a day) 6-7 days a week is 11.500 usd a month! I have now learned the way to tip in USA, and when coming to a different culture you have to follow the norm, but I tell you.. It is a corruptive system, that you have to pay extra to get the service you are paying for through the price on the menu. Anywho.. It&#39;s just my opinion. I still would come again, and would also recommend the Cheesecake Factory to people I know.

Love this restaurant, the bread are freshly bake. The cheesecakes are really mouth watering. The menu&#39;s are exciting! Been here lot&#39;s of times, have to avoid peak hours because you&#39;ll wait even for 1 hour! If your going to eat lunch make sure 11am your already there and if it&#39;s dinner 6pm as early as possible so that you won&#39;t get upset by waiting. Otherwise this restaurant is really a must to see and dine in.

Delicious food, nice waiter, and I had a nice time. We ordered a lot of food and were satisfied. I had leftovers and it was still good the second time. My boyfriend had the fillet mignon and enjoyed it very much as well. The decor is very nice but the placement of our table was a bit close to a large column-like statue and had us cramped on one side of the table. Other than that- great place.

We all know Cheesecake Factory. Huge menu, big portions, lots of cheesecake. The Aventura location is as busy as it gets, with lots of mallgoers packing the host desk. But once you&#39;re seated the service is good, food is quality (for cheesecake factory) and that&#39;s that.
Soooooooo good! I love this cheescakes. And the food is excellent too. Super fan!

Rudest manager experience I have ever had. I order a combo, salmon and steak, steak medium rare and it came out extremely rare. My very nice server came, took it to get cooked up for me. When it came back it was well done, so she  had them start my whole plate over. New person brought me a whole new plate but with chicken. As I do not eat chicken I gave it to my companion as my server didn&#39;t come back for a few minutes. The steak was again well done again and at this point I no longer feel like eating, but the server sends out the steak (hopefully cooked correctly) in a to go bag. When we ask for the check, my dish is still on it. Given that it was sent back as many times as it was I figured I at least given a discount, having not been able to eat my meal. So the manager comes out and very rudely says that we should be thankful because I got 3 plates for the price of one.... meaning the 3 plates that were messed up and were sent back. She then asked where the chicken on the 3rd plate went, and I said my friend took it since I don&#39;t eat chicken. She then said that she would have to charge my friend for it if she was going to take it, even though we never ordered it. Mind you, it&#39;s not just what she is saying, its the eye rolling and condescension. Rather than have them toss , since I already pushed it around with my fork, I gave it to my friend. It is their fault for giving me the wrong dish. She then made my friend take it out of her to go box and put it on a plate to throw away! At this point I&#39;m beyond upset and tell her to take my packed side (the fourth attempt to get it right) and to just take it all off of the check. She was so nasty and condescending the whole time, and refused to tell me her name. I promptly asked for another manger who was much more understanding and apologized on the other woman&#39;s behalf. I know it&#39;s a casual restaurant but  I expect the management to at the very least be civilized. If you&#39;re going to work in the service industry I would hope the establishment that hires you would at least supplement your lack of decency and home training for customer service training.

This is one of my all time favorite place to casually dine in.  It has never failed me and it is always consistently good no matter what location I go to.  The service is very good here, very attentive staff.  <br><br>This Cheesecake is located in a very busy mall, so therefore the wait can be quite long sometimes...But there is always the bar area for first come, first serve.<br><br>You cannot go wrong at Cheesecake!  Whether it be brunch, lunch or dinner, even happy hour...The plates are always consistently delicious and portions are always generous.
Their farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic pasta is the best! I repeat, THE BEST! Two thumbs up for this wonderful dish!

Seriously I don&#39;t get it... why is the place packed when the Grill on the Alley is not. I think it because the portion sizes are unnecessarily HUGE. I do like the restaurant, but only because it is consistent but certainly not exceptional. <br><br>THINGS TO TRY: <br>...Any salad is good and can be shared for 2+ people O<br>...Lettuce wraps are solid and nicely prepared <br>...Fried shrimp, it is good, but I don&#39;t believe they prepare them in the restaurant, they appear to be from a big old frozen bag <br>...They make a good hamburger <br>... Asparagus omelet <br><br>What i don&#39;t like is that they seem to use a lot of prepackaged foods that are defrosted and cooked on premise. <br><br>BONUS TIME: If you luck out and get a good bartender, they make a good martini. <br><br>BIG TIP 1: Look for seats at the bar first, it is first come first seated and will save you a 45 minute wait. <br><br>BIG TIP 2: They make lunch sizes of entrees, so you can save some coin and the portion is basically normal restaurant size. <br><br>BIG TIP 3: The best meal they served is breakfast, they make some kick ass omelettes

Ah sweet mother of the divine overload. I ate too much again.  And I only ate HALF of what was put in front of me.  My mother would have had a FIT...&#34;with all the starving children in the world&#34;.  Ah ma, these days we box it up and take it home.<br><br>ROASTED VEGETABLES AND GOAT CHEESE PIZZA <br>Roasted Japanese Eggplant, Red and Yellow Peppers, Grilled Onion, Artichokes, Kalamata Olives, Tomato and Mozzarella.  HOT and super tasty and drizzled with virgin olive oil.  <br><br>I had a &#34;Lunch&#34; size portion with a side salad.  Both of which were HUGE...I could only eat half of each.  Seriously, one is big enough for two people..<br><br>Bob had the Luau chicken, again lunch portion which was also HUGE.  I love that too.  I love the wonton wafer they put in between layers of the salad.<br><br>We didn&#39;t have to wait at 1p.m. on a Tuesday and our server was a superstar...really really good.<br><br>But then...terror struck...<br><br>Bob: We can&#39;t come to Cheesecake Factory and not have Cheesecake.<br>Me: I don&#39;t do dessert<br>Bob: BUT ITS CHEESECAKE<br>Me: I especially don&#39;t like dessert that is cheesecake<br>Super Server: Do you want the dessert menu<br>Bob/me: YES!/NO!<br>Bob: OK - you choose...it&#39;s your day<br>Me: OK<br><br>Hmmm..Lemoncello cake.. Layers of Vanilla Cake and Lemon Mascarpone Cream Topped with Streusel and Served with Strawberries and Whipped Cream<br><br>Best kept secret at Cheesecake Factory.

So extremely disappointed in the staff at this establishment. Our food was ok, although it was not all brought out at the same time to our table. But I was even more annoyed that I left a water cup on the table and care back 30 minutes later to find out that they had thrown it away. Why would you not put something like that in the back to see if someone comes back for it. Pure laziness and lack of customer service. Just for that, I will NEVER go back!!!!
So much better than the Olive Garden just down the road. Maybe a couple dollars more but much very much worth it. They have a huge menu so bring the whole family.

Wow, it has been so long since I have been to a Cheesecake Factory. <br>After a great movie we walked downstairs to grab some grub and chill. The place was packed since there was a horrible rainstorm. We got lucky and snagged a high top in the bar area. Our server Kyle greeted us quickly getting our drink order. <br><br>We decided to order some apps, wine and beer. Food came out quickly and hot. I ordered the chicken nachos and like everything here the portions are huge. The nachos had great flavored shredded chicken, melted Mexican cheese, sour cream, guacamole, tomato&#39;s and jalapenos. They really hit the spot and were delish. <br><br>My friend&#39;s buffalo chicken bites were huge and looked very good. I was to busy eating my nachos to try.
